src: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
mt: Pastiake tanganmu bisa rileks sajoneh sing bisa ngecakake seluruh notenya - uga coba ora nggawe gerakan ekstren sing luwih akibat. Kaya ngone, kalian bakal kelelahan diri kalian sajoneh sing bisa. Inging kalian ora perlu ngecakake kunci kalian kanthi akibat sing luwih kanggo volume sing luwih kaya ing piano. Ing akordion, kanggo volume sing luwih, kalian nggunakake bellow kalian kanthi akibat sing luwih utawa kecepatan.
ref: Mesthekake tanganmu anteng kambi isih nabuh kabeh calathu kanthi bener - uga coba driji-drijimu aja kakehan obah. Kanthi cara iki, sampeyan bakal ora krasa kesel banget. Kudu dieling-eling yen sampeyan ora kudu nggunakake tenaga sing gedhe kanggo mijet kunci kuwi kaya mijet piano. Ing akordian, kanggo entuk volume tambahan, sampeyan nggunakake embusan kanthi luwih mlenet lan cepet.

Ing akordian, kanggo entuk volume tambahan, sampeyan nggunakake embusan kanthi luwih mlenet lan cepet.

src: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.
mt: Masalah paling umum nalika nggawe file video dadi format DVD yaiku overscan. Televisi umume diasilake supaya bisa ngecakake umum. Amarga iku, kabeh sing katon ing TV wis diiris, saka atas, bawah lan sisi. Iki diasilake supaya gambar bisa ngecakake seluruh layar. Iki diarani overscan. Nanging, nalika nggawe DVD, pinggirane mungkin uga diiris, lan kalo file video duwe subtitel, mungkine ora bisa kagolong.
ref: Salah sawijining masalah sing paling umum nalika nyoba ngowahi film dadi bentuk DVD yaiku overscan. Akeh TV digawe kanthi cara kanggo nyenengake masarakat umum. Kanthi alesan kuwi, kabeh sing sampeyan deleng ana TV wis diowahi. Iki digawe kanggo mesthekake menawa gambar nutup kabeh layar. Iki diarani overscan. Sayange, nalika sampeyan nggawe DVD, watesan uga bakal dikethok, lan yen vidio kasebut duwe naskah guneman kliwat cedhak mangisor, ora bakal diketokake kanthi ganep.

src: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.
mt: Plan Amerika ngandhutake nggawe serangan koordinasi saka tiga arah kang beda. Jenderal John Cadwalder bakal nggawe serangan pembangkang ing gendhing Inggris ing Bordentown, supaya nggawe kakuatan pambalak ing ngendi. Jenderal James Ewing bakal nggawa 700 milisi saka sungai Trenton Ferry, nggawe gendhing ing sungai Assunpink Creek lan nggawe kakuatan musuh saka kabur. Kakuatan serangan utama saka 2.400 wong bakal nggawa saka sungai 9 mil lor saka Trenton, lan banjur dipisah dadi loro, siji ing ngandhutake Greene lan siji ing ngandhutake Sullivan, supaya nggawe serangan sadurungi pagi.
ref: Rancangane wong Amerika ngandalke serangan sing diluncurke lan uga wis dirancang saka telung arah sing beda-beda. Jenderal John Cadwalder bakal nganakake sawijining serangan pengalihan nglawan garnisun Inggris ing Bordentown, supaya nutup bala pambiyantu. Jenderal James Ewing bakal ngetokake 700 pasukan sadawane kali ana ing kapal Feri Trenton, kanggo ngrebut Kalen Assunpink lan nyegah prajurit mungsuh supaya ora mlayu. Kakuwatan serangan sing utama 2.400 prajurit bakal nyebrang kali 9 mil menyang lor Trenton, banjur dipisah dadi 2 klompok, siji dipimpin Greene lan siji dipimpin Sullivan, supaya bisa gawe serangan sadurunge-subuh.

src: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."
mt: “Sawise diadopsi dening Kongres tanggal 4 Juli, naskah tangan sing ditandatangani dening Presiden Kongres John Hancock lan Sekretaris Charles Thomson banjur diwatesi kira-kira 150 meter saka tempat nggawe naskah karo John Dunlap. Nanging, lewat malam antara 150-200 naskah diwatesi, kini dikenal minangka “Dunlap broadsides”. Bacaan publik pertama naskah iki diwaca dening John Nixon ing lapangan Independence Hall tanggal 8 Juli. Satu diwatesi karo George Washington tanggal 6 Juli, sing diwaca dening tentara-tentara ing New York tanggal 9 Juli. Naskah kasebut tiba ing London tanggal 10 Agustus. 25 naskah Dunlap broadsides sing dikenal adohi iki yaiku naskah paling tuwa sing dikenal adohi naskah iki. Naskah tangan asli ora tau adohi.”
ref: Sawise diadopsi dening Kongres ing 4 Juli, sawijining naskah isi ditapakasmani dening Presiden Kongres John Hancock lan Sekertaris Charles Thomson banjur dikirim pirang-pirang blok adohe menyang toko percetakan John Dunlap. Liwat wayah wengi antarane 150 lan 200 salinan digawe, saiki dikenal kanthi jeneng “selebaran Dunlap”. Wacan umum sepisan saka dokumen iku yaiku dening John Nixon ing pekarangan Aula Kamardikan ing 8 Juli. Siji dikirim menyang George Washington tanggal 6 Juli, sing diwacakne menyang prajurite ning New York tanggal 9 Juli. Salinane tekan ning London tanggal 10 Agustus. 25 Selebaran Dunlap sing isih diweruhi anane iku salinan sing isih wutuh saka dokumene. Salinan tulisan tangan sing asli wis ora ana.

src: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.
mt: Kolonis, nglihat aktivitas iki, uga ngrungokake pambantuan. Tentara sing nambahke posisi depan kalebu regimen 1 lan 3 New Hampshire sing 200 wong, ing bawah Kolonel John Stark lan James Reed (keduwéna ngejaba dadi jendral). Tentara Stark ngambil posisi ing sekat ing sisih lor saka posisi Kolonis. Saamana bali saka pasang surut ning Sungai Mystic ing sisih lor-wetan saka pulo, luwih cepetan nggawe sekat saka batu sing pendek nganti lor nganti bali saka pasang surut ning pasir cilik. Gridley utawa Stark ngeletake tandan kira-kira 100 kaki (30 m) ing depan sekat lan ngrungokake yen ora nggawe sesebutan nganti regulars nganti tandan.
ref: Para panjajah kasebut, ningali kamempengan iki, uga njaluk wadyabala. Bala sing nguwatake posisi maju kalebu resimen New Hampshire kaping 1 lan 3 saka 200 wong, ana ing Kulnel John Stark lan James Reed (loro-lorone banjur dadi jendral). Anak buwahe Stark manggon ana pager ning sisih lor panggonan Penjajah. Nalika ombak surut mbukak clah ing Kali Mistik sadawane lor wetane semenanjung, ombak surut kuwi bakal langsung gawe pager kanthi tembok watu cendhek menyang lor nuju pinggirane banyu ana ing pantai sing cilik. Gridley utawa Stark nancepake tiang kira-kira 100 kaki (30 m) ing ngarep pager lan mrintahake supaya ora ana sing nembak nganti anggotane liwat.

src: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
mt: China kuna duwe cara unik kanggo nampilake periode wektu sing beda; setiap tahapan China utawa setiap kulawarga sing ana ing kakuasaan yaiku dinasti sing beda. Uga antara setiap dinasti ana usaha usaha sing stabil kanggo provinsi sing beda. Dinasti sing paling misuwur yaiku era tiga kerajaan sing dumadi 60 taun antara dinasti Han lan Jin. Nalika wektu iki ana perang sing keji ing antarane kabeh ningrat sing nglawan kanggo takhta. Tiga kerajaan yaiku salah sijine era sing paling keji ing sejarah China kuna, ribuan wong mati saka perang kanggo duduk ing kursi ing istana ing Xi’an.
ref: China Kuno nduweni cara sing ora biyasa kanggo nuduhke jaman;saben tingkatan China utawa saben kaluwarga sing nduweni kakuwasan kuwi dinasti sing khas. Uga ing antarane saben dinasti ana mangsa kang ora stabil saka provinsi kang dibagi. Sing paling misuwur saka periode iki yaiku jaman Telu Kerajaan sing suwene 60 taun antarane Dinasti Han lan Jin. Wanci perang sengit iki kadadeyan nalika akeh darah luhur sing rebutan tahta. Telu Krajan iku yaiku siji saka jaman-jaman paling kebak getih ing sejarah Cina Kuno ewunan wong mati berjuang kanggo lungguh ing kursi paling dhuwur ing kraton agung ing Xi’an.

src: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.
mt: Kolonilang koloni semut tentara ngembar lan ngendep ing fase beda-beda. Ing fase nomad, semut tentara ngembar ing malam lan ngendep ing dina. Koloni mulai fase nomad nalika panganan sing disediakake wis berkurang. Ing fase iki, koloni nggawe ngendep sing sementara sing diubah saben dina. Sajrone fase ngembar iki, rampajane koloni utawa ngembar kira-kira 17 dina.
ref: Koloni semut wadyabala baris munggah lan nusuh ing macem-macem fase uga. Ing fase ngumbara, semut prajurit baris nalika wengi lan mandheg kanggo kemah nalika awan. Koloni miwiti fase ngumbara nalika pangan sing cumepak kari sathithik. Nalika fase iki, koloni gawe sarang sawetara sing malih-malih saben dinane. Saben kerusuhan nomaden utawa baris iki bakal lumaku kurang luwih 17 dina.

src: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
mt: Ritme-ritme sing umum ditemokake ing fisiologi lan perilaku kadang-kadang kritis nggantung karo adhangan siklus endogen lan produksi karo jam biologis. Ritme-ritme periodik, sing ora mung jawaban marang cahya periodik sing ana ing luar, wis dilaporke kanggo kabeh makluk hidup, kalebu bakteri, jamur, tumbuhan, lan hewan. Jam biologis iku oscillator sing bisa nggantung siklus bebas nggantung ing absen saka cahya sing ana ing luar.
ref: Akeh observasi ritme ing fisiologi lan tumindak kerep gumantung banget marang anane siklus endogen lan produksine liwat jam biologis. Wirama periodik, dudu mung wangsulan marang sasmita periodik saka njaba, wis dibuktekake kanthi bener kanggo umume makluk urip, kalebu bakteri, jamur, tanduran, lan kewan. Jam biologis yaiku osilator panyengkuyung mandhiri sing bakal nglanjutake wektu bebas-pit-pitan mlayu bahkan tanpa isyarat saka njaba.

src: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.
mt: Populasi iku kumpulan organisme saka spesies khusus ing wilayah geografis sing ditetapake. Nalika kabeh individu ing populasi iku identik karo sawijining karakter fenotip kaya-kaya, kaya-kaya iku dikenal minangka monomorfik. Nalika individu ngilangake sawetara variasi saka sawijining karakter kaya-kaya, kaya-kaya iku dikenal minangka polimorfik.
ref: Populasi yaiku kumpulan organisme saka spesies tartamtu sajerone wilayah geografis kang ditamtokake. Nalika kabeh individu ing populasi iku identik gegayutan karo ciri fenotipe tartamtu dheweke dikenal kanthi aran monomorfik. Nalika ana individu sing nuduhake sipat-sipat tartamtu mangka dianggep dadi polimorpik.

src: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
mt: Wisata alam nggawe wong sing kaguman nganti alam alam kanggo tujuan nggoleki pemandangan, kalebu tetuwuhan lan hewan. Conto aktivitas ing tempat yaiku ngelakakake, ngelakakake, fotografi, ngamati burung, lan ngunjungi taman lan ngerti informasi babagan ekosistem. Conto yaiku ngunjungi, ngamati, lan ngerti babagan organgatuangs ing Borneo.
ref: Plesiran sing didhasarke-alam bisa narik akeh wong sing kepingin plesir menyang alam kanthi tujuan ngamati pandhangan, kalebu wit-witan uga kewan liar. Conto kamempengan ing panggonan kalebu mburu, mancing, motret, nonton manuk, lan ngunjungi taman lan nliti babagan ekosistem. Contone ngunjungi, motret, lan sinau babagan organgatuangs ing Kalimantan.

src: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
mt: Kulawarga nggoleki kutha-kutha cilik setiap dina nggojek mobil kanggo nggoleki tempat kerja lan dilintasi dening kulawarga liyane sing tujuan kerja ing tempat sing wis ditinggake. Ing sistem transportasi shuttle iki kabeh nggoleki lan nggoleki sistem transportasi sing didasari ing mobil-mobil pribadi. Ilmu saiki ngindikasike yèn sistem karbon sing gedhe iki nggoleki biosfer saka salah sijining saka siji saka siji sing nggoleki evolusi manungsa kanggo wektu 2 yuta taun.
ref: Saben esuk, wong-wong ninggalake kutha cilik nganggo montor menyang panggonane nyambut gawe lan papasan karo wong sing panggonan nyambut gawene ana ning kutha cilik kuwi. Ing transportasi menyang-mulih sing dinamis iki saben uwong iku embuh kepiye carane isa padha sambung, lan nyengkuyung, sawijining sistem transportasi adhedhasar mobil-mobil pribadi. Kawruh saiki nuduhake manawa ekonomi karbon gedhen iki wis nolak biosfer saka salah sawijining negara kukuh sing wis ndhukung megaring manungsa sajrone rong yuta taun kepungkur.

src: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.
mt: Atom bisa dianggep minangka salah sijining blok bangunan fundamental saka bahan-bahan. Entitas sing paling kompleks iki, menurut model Bohr sing sederhana, yaiku inti sing diorbiti dening elektron, sing mirip karo planit sing diorbiti dening matahari - lihat Gambar 1.1. Inti kasebut terdiri saka loro partikel - neutron lan proton. Proton duwe muatan listrik positif, sementara neutron ora duwe muatan. Elektron duwe muatan listrik negatif.
ref: Atom bisa dianggep minangka salah sawijining balok bangunan dhasar babagan saka kabeh bahan. Kabeh iki kompleks banget sing kalebu, miturut model Bohr sing wis digawe sedehana, saka punjer nukleus sing diubengi elektron, katon persis karo planet sing ngubengi srengenge - deleng Gambar 1.1. Nukleus digawe saka rong partikel - nutron lan proton. Proton duwe amot listrik positif menawi neutron ora duwe amot. Elektron duwe amot listrik negatif.

src: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
mt: Komputer sing saiki umum dipakakake nggawe manipulasi informasi sing dicode ing wujud angka biner. Angka biner bisa duwe sajeroning dua nilai, yaiku 0 utawa 1, lan angka-angka iki diarani digit biner - utawa bit, kanggo nggunakake jargon komputer.
ref: Meh kabeh komputer sing dienggo saiki didhasarke dening manipulasi informasi sing digawe kode kanthi wujut angka kembar. Angka kembar bisa nduweni rangking mung siji utawa loro, umpamane 0 utawa 1, lan angka-angka iki diarani dijit kembar - utawa bit, sing nggunakake jargon komputer.

src: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: Blog uga bisa ngecapake tulisan siswa. Siswi biasane awal blog sing kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo kacatetan karo
ref: "Blog uga bisa ngewangi ngundhakake keterampilan nulise siswa. Sanadyan siswa kerep miwiti pengalaman bloge kanthi tata basa lan ejaan sing semrawut, anane pamaca umume ngowahi iku. Amarga siswa asring dadi pamiarsa paling seneng ngritig, panulis blog wiwit nyoba nambah tulisan supaya ora oleh kritig. Uga gawe blog “meksa para siswa supaya luwih pinter marang donya ana sekitarane.” Kabutuhan marang makani rasa kepingin mangerteni bab anyar saka para tamu iki ngilhami para siswa supaya sregep lan nyenengke (Toto, 2004). Ngeblog iku piranti sing ngilhami kolaborasi, lan nyengkuyung murid- murid kanggo ngambakake pasinaon kanthi apik sanjabaning dina sekolah tradisional. Panggunaan blog sing cocog ""bisa menehi kakuwatan marang murid dadi luwih seneng nliti lan ngritig; kanthi aktif mangsuli materi Internet, murid bisa nemtokake dunung ing kahanan tulisan wong liya lan njlentrehake wawasane dhewe babagan masalah tartamtu (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
mt: Komunikasi asinkron ngutamake wektu kanggo refleksi lan reaksi marang wong liyane. Iki nyediakake murid kemampuan kanggo kerja ing pase masing-masing lan kontroling pase informasi instruksional. Ing tambahan, ana kurang wektu sing nggawe aturan karo kemungkinan kerja sing fleksibel. (Bremer, 1998) Penggunaan Internet lan World Wide Web nyediakake akses marang informasi ing kabeh wektu. Murid uga bisa ngirimake pertanyaan marang instruktur ing kabeh wektu dina lan ngandhut jawabane sing rasonye cepet, ketimbang nunggu nganti ketemuane wulang.
ref: Komunikasi asinkron nyengkutung wektu kanggo refleksi lan reaksi marang wong liya. Iki ngidinake para siswa mampu kanggo kerja kanthi cepete dheweke dhewe padha lan ngatur cepete informasi pasinaon. Sakliyane kuwi, ana wayah larangan sing luwih cepet kanthi anane kasempatan jam kerja sing luwih bisa diowah-owahi. (Bremer, 1998) Panganggone Internet lan Jaringan Luas Donya menehi kemungkinan pembelajar kanggo duwe akses marang informasi saben wektu. Siswa-siswa uga bisa nglumpukke pitakonan marang guru sak wayah-wayah lan ngarepake tanggepan kanthi cepet, tinimbang ngenteni nganti kelas langsung.

src: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
mt: Kastil tradisional abad tengah duweke paningalan sing dawa ngiluakake imajinasi, ngiluakake gambaran kaya joust, pesta lan keperkasaan Arthur. Nanging, ing ngendi kastil abad tengah duweke 1000 taun, bisa ngiluakake suara lan bau saka perang sing wis lewih, ngiluakake suara kaya klaksonan kuda ing kaca lan bau takut sing muncul saka pit kastil. Nanging, apakah imajinasi kita duweke realitas? Kajaba, apa sing ngiluakake kastil diasilake? Kaya apa kastil diasilake lan dianggepake?
ref: Astana abad pertengahan tradisional wis awit suwe nginspirasi imajinasi, nyulap gambaran olahraga joust, jamuan lan kasatriyan jaman Arthur. Ngadek ing tengah-tengah reruntuhan sing umure ewon taun uga gampang kanggo nggawa pikiran menyang swara lan ambu paprangan sing wis suwe ilang, kanggo ameh krungu swara sikil jaran ing dalan watu lan kanggo ngambu rasa wedi sing munggah saka rong ing jero lemah. Nanging apa angen-angene dhewe didhasari dening kasunyatan? Pisanan kenapa astana iku dibangun? Kepriye astana kuwi dirancang lan dibangun?

src: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.
mt: Kirby Muxloe Castle ing jaman biasa, yaiku rumah kanggo dipertahanke, ora kaya kastil. Kaca gedhe lan dinding tipis ora bisa nahan serangan kanggo lama. Ing 1480-an, nalika konstruksi dimulai dening Lord Hastings, negara kasebut cedhak lan pertahanan cedhak karo bala kecil sing roving.
ref: Khusus kanggo wektu iki, Kraton Kirby Muxloe minangka omah sing luwih kuwat bentenge tinimbang kraton sing sejatine. Cendhela-chendela kacane sing amba lan tembok sing tipis ora bakal bisa nahen serangan sing ditemtokake kanthi suwe, Ing taun 1480an, nalika pembangunane diwiwiti dening Ndara Hastings, negarane lumayan tentrem lan pertahanane amung dibutuhne nglawan kelompok cilik begal.

src: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.
mt: Karo perubahan saka 400 meter dadi 800 meter, kecepatan dadi kurang penting lan ketahanan dadi kebutuhan mutlak. Tentu saja atlet 800 meter, siji sing bisa ngegoleki 2 menit, wajib duwé kecepatan sing cukup, nanging ketahanan wajib dikembangake ing kabutuhan. Cross country running ing musim dingin, digabungake karo kerja gymnasium kanggo bagian ati, yaiku persiapan paling apik kanggo musim panerbangan.
ref: Kanthi owah-owahan saka puteran seprapat mil, kacepetan dadi ora pati penting lan kakukuhan dadi kabutuhan mutlak. Temtune kelas pertama setengah-miler, wong sing bisa ngalahake rong menit, mesthi duwe kwantitas cepet sing cukup, nanging ketahanan mesthi dilatih ing sakabehing bebaya. Sawetara playonan antar lantas negara nalika mangsa salju, digamblokake karo ulah raga fitnes kanggo awak bagean ndhuwur, minangka persiyapan paling apik kanggo ungsum playon.

src: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.
mt: Joging jarak tengah yaiku olahraga sing murah hargane; nanging, ana banyake mitos sing ana ngenani kagunan sing kudu dipunlampah kanggo nglakoni. Produk bisa dipunbeli sajeroning wektu sing diperlukan, nanging akèh-akèhé ora bakal nggawa manfaat sing nyata. Atlet bisa ngerti yen dhèwèke mbutuhake produk nanging ora bakal nggawa manfaat sing nyata.
ref: Mlayu samadya minangka ulahraga sing murah; Nanging, ana salah pangerten babagan sawetara piranti sing dibutuhake kanggo melu. Produke bisa dituku sakbutuhe, nanging ameh kabeh bakal duwe dampak sing sithik utawa ora ana dampake marang kinerjane. Ulahragawan bisa uga rumangsa seneng karo prodhuk kasebut sanajan ora menehi piguna sing nyata.

src: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.
mt: MRI diadopsi saka fenomena fisika sing diarani nuklir resonansi magnetik (NMR), sing diarani ing taun 1930-an dening Felix Bloch (sing kerja ing Universitas Stanford) lan Edward Purcell (saka Universitas Harvard). Ing resonansi iki, medan magnet lan gelombang radio nggawe atom nggoleki sinyal radio cilik. Taun 1970, Raymond Damadian, dokter lan ahli penelitian, nemokake basis kanggo nggunakake resonansi magnetik kanggo diagnostik medis. Paten dianugerahake, sing dadi paten pisanan ing donya ing bidang MRI. Taun 1977, Dr. Damadian rampung nggawe scanner MRI “whole-body” pisanan, sing diarani “Indomitable”.
ref: Pathokane MRI kuwi yaiku kadadean fisika sing diarani resonansi magnet nuklir (NMR), sing ditemokake taun 1930 dening Felix Bloch (sing nyambut gawe ana ing Universitas Stanford) lan Edward Purcell (saka Universitas Harvard). Ana resonansi iki, medan magnet lan gelombang radio nyebabke atom-atom ngirimke sinyal radio sing cilik banget. Ing taun 1970, Raymond Damadian, dhokter pangobatan lan ahli elmu panliti, nemokake dhasar kanggo nggunakake pepethan resonansi maknit minangka alat kanggo diagnosa pangobatan. Patang sasi sabanjure hak paten diwenehake, sing dadi paten kapisan kanggo perkara bidang MRI ana donya. Taun 1977, Dr. Damadian ngrampungke bangunan mesin pindai MRI “kabeh-awak”, sing dijenengi “Indomitable”.

src: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.
mt: Manusia yaiku spesies sing paling kawisata ing baca pikiran liyane. Sing artine yaiku kita bisa sukses memprediksi apa sing dianggep, dikehendaki, percaya, ketahui utawa dikehendaki. Antara kawruh-kawruh iki, ngerti niat liyane yaiku penting. Iki nyediakake kita kanggo ngresiki kemungkinan-kemungkinan fisik tindakan. Misale, kalo kalian ngliwati seseorang sing ngobrak-abrik jendhela mobil, kalian mungkin ngira yen kalian ngobrak-abrik mobil seseorang sing asing. Kalian mung kudu dihukum beda-beda kalo kalian kehilangan kunci mobil lan mobil sing kalian obrak-abrik yaiku mobil sing kalian.
ref: Manungsa minangka titah paling trampil ing maca pikiran wong liya. Iku tegese kita bisa ngramal kanthi sukses kanggo apa sing wong liya rasakake, maksud, percaya, mangerteni utawa pengini. Ing antarane ketrampilan iki, mangerteni karepe wong liya iku penting banget. Iku ndadekake awake dhewe bisa nerangake keambiguan sing bisa kadadean saka tumindak fisik. Contone, yen sampeyan ndeleng wong ngrusak jendhela mobil, sampeyan bisa nganggep manawa dheweke nyoba nyolong mobil wong liya. Dheweke bakal kudu diadili kanthi beda menawa dheweke kunci mobile ilang lan mobile dheweke dhewe sing coba dileboni paksa.

src: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
mt: Walaupun AI duwe konotasi kuwat saka fiksi ilmiah, AI nggawe cabang sing penting saka ilmu komputer, ngrujuk marang perilaku, belajar lan adaptasi inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih inggih
ref: Sanajan Al duwe sawijining konotasi sing kuat saka fiksi ilmiah, Al gawe cabang sing penting banget kanggo ilmu komputer, ngadhepi kelakuan, pasinaon lan adaptasi pinter ing jero sawijining mesin. Penelitian ana ing Al kajaba nyiptakake mesin kanggo nggarap tugas kanthi otomatis sing mbutuhake tumindak sing pinter. Contone kalebu kendhali, perancangan lan pratelan, keconggah kanggo njawab diagnosis lan pitakonan pelanggan, lan pangenalan tulisan tangan, swara lan pasuryan. Sing mengkono iku wis dadi disiplin ilmu sing beda, sing fokus marang nyedhiyani solusi kanggo masalah urip saktemene. Sistem AI saiki asring digunakake ing ekonomi, pangobatan, permesinan lan saradhadhu, amarga wis dibangun ing pirang-pirang piranti komputer omahan lan aplikasi dolanan.

src: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
mt: Polah pikir konvergen menyangkut teknik pemecahan masalah sing nggabungake ide-ide sing beda utawa bidang-bidang kanggo nemuake solusi. Fokus saka polah pikir iki yaiku kecepatan, logika lan akurat, uga identifikasi fakta, reapplying teknik sing ana, ngumpulake informasi. Faktor paling penting saka polah pikir iki yaiku: ana sajine jawaban sing benar. Kamu nggoleki sajine jawaban, yaiku benar utawa salah. Polah pikir iki kaitane karo teknik ilmiah utawa prosedur standar. Warga sing duwe polah pikir iki duwe logika, bisa nggoleki pola-pola, nemuake pemecahan masalah lan kerja ing tes ilmiah.
ref: Cara mikire konvergen yaiku teknik ngrampungake masalah sing nggabungake gagasan utawa ranah sing beda-beda kanggo nemokake solusi. Sing perlu digatekake saka cara pikir iki yaiku cepete, logika lan katelitian, uga cara mriksa kasunyatan, nggunakake maneh teknik sing wis ana, kanthi nglumpukake informasi. Faktor paling penting kanggo cara pikir iki yaiku: namung ana siji jawaban bener. Sampeyan mung mikir rong jawaban, bener utawa salah. Pikirane jinis iki gegayutan karo prosedur ilmu kawruh tartamtu utawa tata cara baku. Wong sing nduweni cara pikir kaya ngene iki bisa mikir kanthi logis, bisa ngeling-eling pola, mecahke perkara lan nggarap ujian ilmiah.

Wong sing nduweni cara pikir kaya ngene iki bisa mikir kanthi logis, bisa ngeling-eling pola, mecahke perkara lan nggarap ujian ilmiah.

src: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
mt: Kerjaan video rekaman wis nggawe penemuan penting ing interpretasi micro-expressions, gerakan wajah sing dawa kira-kira 5 milisekon. Nanging, klaim menawa seseorang bisa deteksi apakah seseorang bojonan, karo nginterpretasi micro-expressions. Oliver Sacks, ing papir The President's Speech, ngindikasike manawa wong sing ora bisa ngerti basa amarga kerusakan otak bisa ngevaluasi kejujuran akurat. Ia uga ngindikasike manawa kemampuan ing nginterpretasi tindakan wong bisa dipunyani saka hewan kaya anjing domestik.
ref: Panggunaan rekaman vidio wis ngasilake panemuan penting ing tapsiran ekspresi mikro, obahing rai sing ana pirang-pirang milidetik. Kanthi khusus, dinyatakake menawa ana sing bisa nemokake menawa wong sing ngapusi kanthi napsirake mikro-ekspresi kanthi bener. Oliver Sacks, ing makalahe Sesorah Presiden, nuhake kepiye wong-wong sing ora bisa paham omongan amarga kerusakan utek sanajan mengkono isa mbiji tulusing ati kanthi akurat. Dheweke bahkan nuduhake kayata kabisan ing sajrone negesi tumindake manungsa isa uga diduweni dening kewan-kewan kayata segawon ingon.

src: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
mt: Kesempatan kanggo ngrampungake wawasan lan ngejar gawe perubahan ing cara sing disebutke ing ngisor iki basis rate ing ngendi wawasan diwenehi gawe perubahan. Pendekatan kanggo ngrampungake informasi beda. Saka kagunan ora lagi tekan ing ingkang bisa diingat, nanging kemampuan kanggo ngingat teks dadi luwih saka fokus. Ing essens, Renaisans nggawe perubahan sing signifikan ing pendekatan kanggo ngrampungake wawasan lan penyebaran wawasan.
ref: Bebarengan karo malihe kemampuan kanggo golek wawasan lan kanggo sinau kanthi cara kaya sing disebutake ing dhuwur rata-rata dhasar ing ngendi wawasan dipikolehi uga malih. Cara kanggo entuk katrangan beda. Pidihan ora ana maneh ing pangelinge wong, nanging kasaguhan kanggo ngeling-eling tulisan dadi luwih jelas. Intine, jaman Renaissance gawe owah-owahan sing penting kanggo cara sinau lan nyebarke ilmu.

src: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
mt: Internet ngemot elemen saka komunikasi masal lan interpersonal. Karakteristik unik saka Internet nggawa dimensi tambahan ing ngendi penggunaan lan kepuasan ngemot. Misal, “belajar” lan “sosialisasi” disarankan minangka pangaribawani penting kanggo penggunaan Internet (James et al., 1995). “Penglibatan pribadi” lan “hubungan sing diterusake” uga diidentifikasi minangka pangaribawani anyar dening Eighmey lan McCord (1998) nalika nginvestigasi reaksi audiens marang situs web.
ref: Internet nggabungke unsur komunikasi klompok lan interpersonal. Beda Karakteristik-karakteristik ing internet ngarah tumuju dimensi tambahan ing terminologi panganggone lan pendekatan gratifikasi. Tuladhane, “sinau” lan “sosialisasi” iku diusulne minangka motivasi penting kanggo nganggo internet (James et al., 1995). “Keterlibatan pribadhi” lan “sesambungan sing terus-terusan” uga diidentifikasi minangka aspek motivasi anyar dening Eighmey lan McCord (1998) nalika dheweke mriksa reaksi pemirsa marang situs web.

src: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
mt: Gothic style ngremuk ing periode antara abad kaping 10-11 lan abad kaping 14. Nalika awal pakaian dianakake kanthi ngremukakake kultura Bizantium ing wétan. Nanging, amarga kanal komunikasi sing adhem, gaya ing wétan bisa mbelengakake kira-kira 25-30 taun. Nalika akir Abad Tengah Eropa Barat awakake gaya dhewe. siji saka perkembangan gedhe abad kasebut minangka hasil saka perang salib, wong wiwit nggunakake tombol kanggo ngepung pakaian.
ref: Gaya gotik kuwi pucuke antarane ana abad 10 - 11 lan ana abad 14. Ing wiwitan klambi iku kepengaruh banget dening budaya Byzantium ing wetan Ananging, amarga saluran komunikasi kang alon, gaya ing kulon bisa ketinggalan kanthi 25 tekan 30 taun. nuju pungkasan Abad Pertengahan Eropa sisih kulon wiwit ngembangke gayane dhewe. salah sawijine asil saka owah-owahan sing kadadeyan ana jaman iki yaiku asil saka perang salib nalika akeh wong wiwit nggunakake benik kanggo ngencengke klambi.

src: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
mt: Kita bisa mulai urip kanthi misuwur marang lingkungan, kita bisa gabung marang gerakan lingkungan, lan kita bisa uga aktivis supaya kurangake penderitaan ing sawetara derajat. Kaya kasebut, iku bisa dadi pengobatan simptomatik ing sawetara kasus. Nanging, apabila kita ora mung ing ngendi solusi sing dawa, mula kita kudu nemokake akar masalah, lan kita kudu nglebokake. Iki bisa dadi cukup jelas yèn donya wis beda akibat saka perubahan sing gedhe amarga ilmuwan lan teknologi, lan masalah wis dadi gedhe amarga populasi sing gedhe lan gaya urip sing luwih gedhe.
ref: Kita bisa miwiti urip kanthi luwih gampang kanggo lingkungan, kita bakal bisa nggabung karo gerakan lingkungan, lan kita malah bisa dadi pamempeng kanggo nyuda panandhang ing mangsa ngarep ing sawetara drajat. Iki iku mung kaya pengobatan simtomatik ing akeh kasus. Nanging, menawa kita ora mung pengen solusi sementara, mula kita kudune nemokake sumber perkara-perkarane, lan kita kudune gawe ora aktif iku kabeh. Cukup jelas menawa donya wis malih akeh amarga majune ilmu lan teknologi manungsa, lan masalah-masalah dadi tambah gedhe amarga kaluwihan populasi lan gaya urip sing boros saka manungsa.

src: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
mt: Keseimbangan kekuasaan iku sistem ing ngendi nagara-nagara Eropa nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake nggabungake ngg
ref: Kwasa sing imbang iku sistem sing negara Eropa goleki kanggo njaga kedaulatan nasional saka kabeg negara Eropa. Gagasane yaiku kabeh negara Eropa kudu ngusadani nyegah siji negara dadi kuwat banget, lan mula saka kuwi pamrentahan nasional asring ganti aliansine kanggo njaga kaseimbangan. Perang Pangganten Spanyol menehi tandha perang pisanan sing masalah utamane yaiku timbang kakuwatan. Iki nandhani owah-owahan sing penting banget, amarga kakuwatan wong Eropa ora bakal nduweni alesan maneh kanggo perang sing dhasare agama. Mula, Perang Telung Puluh Taun iki bakal dadi perang sing keri dhewe sing dijenengi perang agama.

src: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
mt: Ing wektu iki, sejarah Eropa, Gereja Katolik, sing wis dadi kaya lan kuwat, kena tinjau. Saumur sadhuwure abad, agama Kristen wis nggabungake negara-negara Eropa karo beda-beda ing basa lan adat. Kekuatan sing alus nggabungake saka Gereja Kristen nggabungake saka saka raja nganti wong biasa. Salah siji saka tenet Kristen utama yaiku yen kekayaan kudu digunakake kanggo ngurangi penderitaan lan kemiskinan lan yen dana uang saka gereja kasebut khusus kanggo tujuan iki. Kekuatan pusat saka gereja kasebut wis ana ing Roma saumur sadhuwure abad lan konsentrasi kekuatan lan uang kasebut nggabungake akal-akalan maneh yen tenet kasebut kudu dipertemukan.
ref: Nalika periode iki ing sejarah Eropa, Greja Katolik, sing malih dadi sugih lan digdaya, mlebu sajrone pengawasan. Luwih saka sewu taun kepungkur agama Kristen bisa ndadekake negara-negara Eropa dadi siji sanadyan basa lan kabudayane beda. I Iki kabeh ngenani kekuatan sing mangaribawani kabeh wong saka raja nganti kawula. Salah sijine prinsip agama Kristen yaiku bandha kuwi kudu digunakake kanggo nulungi wong sing kasusahan lan dhuwit gereja kuwi ana kanggo alesan kuwi. Otoritas gereja pusat wis tau menyang Roma sasuwene sewu taun lan konsentrasi kakuwatan iki lan dhuwit gawe wong akeh mikir apa prinsip iki wis dilakoni.

src: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
mt: Raja Louis XVI, Ratu Marie Antoinette, loro anak cilik (11 taun Marie Therese lan 4 taun Louis-Charles) lan adik raja, Madam Elizabeth, ing 6 Oktober 1789 ditekan kembali menyang Paris saka Versailles dening massa pasar wadon. Ing kandaraan, dheweke mlebu menyang Paris sing dipisahake dening massa wong sing ngomong lan ngomong ancaman menawa raja lan ratu. Massa wong nggawa kandaraan raja lan ratu karo jendhela kandaraan terbuka. Ing sawijining titik, salah sijining anggota massa nggawa kepala garda raja sing mati ing Versailles ing depan ratu sing ketakutan.
ref: Raja Louis XVI, Ratu Marie Antoniette loro anake-anake sing isih enom (Marie Theresa umur 11 taun lan Louis Charles umur patang taun) lan sedulur wanita Raja, Nyonya Elizabeth, sing keweden, ing tanggal 6 Oktober 1789 dipeksa balik menyang Paris saka Versailles dening gerombolan wanita pasar. Ing gerbong, dheweke bali menyang Paris sing diubengi karo grombolan wong sing bengok-bengok lan nyebutake incim-incim marang Raja lan Ratu. Krumunan wong meksa raja lan ratu kanggo mbukak chendela kretane amba-amba. Ing sawijining titik, ana sawijining anggota pakumpulan ngawe-awe sirah punggawa kraton sing dipateni ing Versailles ing ngarepe ratu sing kaweden.

src: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
mt: Raja Louis XVI, Ratu Marie Antoinette, loro anak cilik (11 taun Marie Therese lan 4 taun Louis-Charles) lan adik raja, Madam Elizabeth, ing 6 Oktober 1789 ditekan kembali menyang Paris saka Versailles dening massa pasar wadon. Ing kandaraan, dheweke mlebu menyang Paris sing dipisahake dening massa wong sing ngomong lan ngomong ancaman menawa raja lan ratu. Massa wong nggawa kandaraan raja lan ratu karo jendhela kandaraan terbuka. Ing sawijining titik, salah sijining anggota massa nggawa kepala garda raja sing mati ing Versailles ing depan ratu sing ketakutan.
ref: Raja Louis XVI, Ratu Marie Antoniette loro anake-anake sing isih enom (Marie Theresa umur 11 taun lan Louis Charles umur patang taun) lan sedulur wanita Raja, Nyonya Elizabeth, sing keweden, ing tanggal 6 Oktober 1789 dipeksa balik menyang Paris saka Versailles dening gerombolan wanita pasar. Ing gerbong, dheweke bali menyang Paris sing diubengi karo grombolan wong sing bengok-bengok lan nyebutake incim-incim marang Raja lan Ratu. Krumunan wong meksa raja lan ratu kanggo mbukak chendela kretane amba-amba. Ing sawijining titik, ana sawijining anggota pakumpulan ngawe-awe sirah punggawa kraton sing dipateni ing Versailles ing ngarepe ratu sing kaweden.

src: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
mt: Kawruh internasional sing diatur dening perjanjian internasional sing wis ana saka telung abad iki, Britania nggawe blokade laut sing efektif, sing nggawe kacatetan vital militèr lan sipil, walaupun blokade iki nglanggar hukum internasional sing diakui dening umum. Britania nggawe geni ing sagara internasional kanggo nggawe kabeh kapal sing wis nggawe kacatetan, sing nggawe kacatetan ing kabeh kapal sing ora nggawe kacatetan, walaupun kacatetan iki ora nggawe kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh kabeh
ref: Sanalika sakwise pecahe pamusuhan, Inggris miwiti pamblokiran angkatan laut tumrap Jerman. Siyasat iki kabukten ampuh, lan manced pasokan militer lan sipil sing penting, sanajan pangepungan iki nglanggar undhang-undhang internasional sing ditampa kanthi umum sing diatur dening sawetara prajanjian internasional sajrone rong abad kepungkur. Inggris masang ranjau ana ing laut internasional kanggo nyegah kapal-kapal supaya ora mlebu wilayah segara, mbebayani kapal-kapal netral. Amarga ana wangsulan sing diwatesi kanggo rencana iki, Jerman ngarepake wangsulan sing padha karo perang kapal silem sing tanpa wates.

src: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
mt: Ing Amerika Serikat, ana kira-kira 400,000 kasus sing dikenal Multiple Sclerosis (MS), nyithakake minangka penyakit neurologis sing paling akèh ing wong-wong muda lan wong-wong ing umur tengah. MS yaiku penyakit sing nggoyang sistem saraf pusat, sing kalebu otak, sumbu lan saraf optik. Penelitian wis nemu yèn wong-wanita duwé kemungkinan loro kanggo duwé MS tinimbang wong-wong.
ref: Ana ing Amerika Serikat, ana kurang luwih 400.000 kasus Sklerosis Dobel (MS) sing wis dimangerteni, ndadekake iki dadi penyakit neurologis sing misuwur kanggo wong diwasa setengah tuwo lan sing isih nom. MS minangka lelaran sing mangaruhi sistem sarap pusat, sing kasusun saka otak, sumsum tulang mburi, lan sarap optik. Panaliten wis nemokake menawa wong wadon ping pindho luwih mungkin duwe MS tinimbang wong lanang.

src: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.
mt: Penelitian nggawe pangertan yèn depresi, takut lan kacatatan ngemudakake hubungan antara rasa sakit lan cacat ing penderita rasa sakit ing punggung bawah. Saja pengaruh kacatatan, ora depresi lan takut dadi kondisional sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan sesorangan
ref: Panlitian kasebut nemokake menawa depresi, rasa wedi lan kasangsaran nengahi hubungan antarane lara lan cacat ing wong kang lara nyeri boyok. Mung aruh-aruhan malapetaka, dudu depresi lan rasa wedi sing dadi syarat sesi PA terstruktur saben minggu. Wong-wong kang melu ing kegiatan reguler mbutuhne dukungan ing perkara persepsi negatif saka rasa lara njelasake bedane antara lara kronis lan rasa ora kepenak saka awak obah sing normal.

src: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
mt: Olahraga modern saka pedang dimainake ing saben tingkatan, saka siswa sing belajar ing universitas nganti kompetisi profesional lan Olimpiade. Olahraga iki umume dimainake ing format duel, siji pedang duel siji pedang liyane.
ref: Olahraga anggar modern dimainke ing akeh tingkatan, saka murid-murid sing sinau ing universitas nganti kompetisi tetandhingan profesional lan Olimpiade. Ulahraga iki utamane dilakokake ing bentuk tandhing, siji fencer nglawan liyane.

src: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
mt: Korban saka racun sing nggawa ing awak mungkin ora bisa ditangkep. Gejala, kaya muntah, bisa cukup umum supaya diagnosis langsung ora bisa dilakokake. Indikasi paling apik saka racun sing nggawa ing awak mungkin yaiku adhangan terbuka saka obat-obatan utawa racun rumah tangga sing bisa racun. Cek label kanggo instruksi pertama bantuan spesifik kanggo racun sing kasebut.
ref: Kena racun saka njero bisa uga ora katon langsung. Tandhane, kayata mutah sing katon lumrah mula diagnosis langsung ora bisa ditindakake. Tandha keracunan internal sing paling katon yaiku anane wadhah obat mbukak utawa bahan kimia omahan kang ngemot racun. Priksa label kanggo pedhoman pitulungan sepisan kanggo racun pesifik iku.

src: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
mt: Ana akibat sosial lan politik kaya penggunaan sistem metrik, perpindahan saka absolutisme menyang republikanisme, nasionalisme lan percaya negara iki milik rakyat ora mung siji pemimpin. Uga sawise Revolusi pekerjaan terbuka kanggo kabeh pambayaran pria sing nggawe kabeh sing paling ambisius lan sukses bisa sukses. Sama karo militèr amarga panggolongan ora karo panggolongan kelas saiki kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kagolongane kag
ref: Ana pengaruh sing akeh banget saka kahanan sosial lan politik kayata gunane sistem metrik, owah-owahan saka absolutisme dadi republikanisme, nasionalisme lan keyakinan yen negara kuwi diduweni dening kabeh wong ora mung kanggo pimpinan tunggal. Uga sakwise Revolusi gaweyan iku dibukak kanggo kabeh pelamar lanang ngidini kanggo wong sing paling ambisius lan sukses duwe asil. Bab sing padha berlaku kanggo militer amarga pangkat tentara minangka gentine adhedhasar kelas dheweke padha saiki adhedhasar cailaber. Revolusi Prancis uga menehi semangat kanggo akeh wong kelas pagawe sing ditindhes ing negara liya kanggo miwiti revolusine dhewe.

src: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
mt: Semua wong ngelakoni masyarakat lan nggunakake sistem transportasi. Nalika isih langka wong ngelakoni kualitas banyu utawa jembatan sing runtuh. Apa kuduane sistem transportasi nggawe klaim sing kaya iki, apa kuduane sistem transportasi gagal saben dina? Apa para insinyur transportasi ora kompeten? Atau apa sing paling mendasar lagi?
ref: Kabeh wong melu andil ing masyarakat lan nggunakake sistem transportasi. Ameh kabeh wong sambat babagan sistem transportasi. Ing negara-negara maju, sampeyan arang banget ngrungokake sesambat sing padha babagan kwalitas banyu utawa jembatan. Kenapa sistem transportasi marakake wong-wong padha sambat, kenapa sisteme gagal saben dinane? Apa insinyur transportasi iku ora kompeten? Utawa ana perkara sing luwih dhasar.

src: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
mt: Semua wong ngelakoni masyarakat lan nggunakake sistem transportasi. Nalika isih langka wong ngelakoni kualitas banyu utawa jembatan sing runtuh. Apa kuduane sistem transportasi nggawe klaim sing kaya iki, apa kuduane sistem transportasi gagal saben dina? Apa para insinyur transportasi ora kompeten? Atau apa sing paling mendasar lagi?

Ing negara-negara maju, sampeyan arang banget ngrungokake sesambat sing padha babagan kwalitas banyu utawa jembatan. Kenapa sistem transportasi marakake wong-wong padha sambat, kenapa sisteme gagal saben dinane? Apa insinyur transportasi iku ora kompeten? Utawa ana perkara sing luwih dhasar.

src: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
mt: Traffic Flow yaiku studi babagan gerakan saka individu pengemudi lan kendaraan antarane loro titik lan interaksi sing dilakokake karo siji lanang. Sayang, studi babagan traffic flow sulit amarga perilaku pengemudi ora bisa diprediksi kanthi persentase 100%. Sempet, pengemudi mbutuhake perilaku ing ronge sing konsisten; mula, arus traffic tendhesis konsisten lan bisa diwakili matematis. Untuk ngruwat traffic flow, hubungan wis diwujudake antarane tiga karakteristik utama: (1) flow, (2) density, lan (3) velocity. Hubungan iki bisa nggawe perencanaan, perancangan, lan operasi fasilitas jalan raya.
ref: Arus Lalu-Lintas yaiku pelajaran bab pergerakan para pengemudi individu lan kendharaan antara loro titik lan interaksi sing dheweke padha gawe siji marang liyane. Eman banget, nyinau arus lalu lintas kuwi angel amarga kabiyasane sopir ora bisa dibedheg kanthi pesthi. Untunge, para supir condhong tumindak kanthi cukup ajeg; mula, ilen-ilen lalu lintas condhong duwe salaras sing bisa dingerteni lan bisa dituduhake kanthi matematis. Kanggo nggambarake ilen-ilen lalu lintas sing luwih apik, hubungan wis ditetepake antarane telung kaanan utama: (1) ilen-ilen, (2) kapadhetan, lan (3) kacepetan. Hubungan iki mbantu gawe rencana, ngrancang lan operasi fasilitas dalan raya.

src: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
mt: Kesimpulan Hershey lan Chase ing eksperimen iki dadi salah sijining saran sing paling utama yèn DNA iku bahan genetik. Hershey lan Chase nggunakake phage, utawa virus, kanggo ngepangake DNA ing phage karo DNA ing bakteri. Mereka melakuke dua eksperimen nggawe DNA ing phage karo fosfor radioaktif utawa protein ing phage karo sulfur radioaktif.
ref: Eksperimen Harshey lan Chase iku salah sawijining unsur-unsur utama menawa DNA iku sawijining bahan genetik. Hershey lan Chase nggunakake fag, utawa virus, kanggo nandurke DNAne dhewe menyang bakteri. Dheweke gawe pacoban pindho nandhani DNA fag kanthi fosfor radioaktif utawa protein fag kanthi sulfur radioaktif.

src: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
mt: Kambing dadi dipelihara kira-kira 10.000 taun ing Gunung Zagros Iran. Budaya kuna lan suku mulihake kambing kanggo akses gampang dadi susu, rambut, daging, lan kulit. Kambing domestik umume dipelihara ing kawanan sing berjalan ing bukit utawa wilayah liyane sing ditepungi, umume ditangani dening anak-anak utawa remaja sing sering dikenal minangka pemelihara domba. Metode peliharaan iki isih digunakake saiki.
ref: Wedhus delokane wis dijinakake pisanan kanthi kasar 10.000 tahun kepungkur ing Pegunungan Zagros ing Iran. Kabudayan lan suku kuna kuwi wiwit njaga supaya gampang golek dalan kanggo golek susu, rambut, daging, lan kulit. Wedhus umahan umume disimpen ing klompok kewan sing kluyuran ing gumuk-gumuk utawa dhaerah-dhaerah liyane, sing asring dijaga dening para pangon wedhus sing asring bocah utawa remaja, meh padha karo pangon sing umume dikenal. Cara angon iki isih digunakake nganti saiki.

src: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
mt: Golf ya iku permainan sing pemain nggunakake klub kanggo ngepung bal menyang lubang. Dua puluh delapan lubang di mainake nalika ronde normal, karo pemain biasane ngawali ing lubang pisanan ing kursus lan ngakhiri ing lubang delapan belas. Pemain sing nggunakake paling sedikit stroke, utawa gerakan klub, kanggo ngepung kursus menang. Permainan di mainake ing rumput, lan rumput ing sekitar lubang di mow nangkep lan diarani green.
ref: Golf iku dolanan sing pemaine nggunakake penthung kanggo nuthuk bal menyang bolongan. Wolu welas rongan dimainke nalika puteran reguler, kanthi pemain biasane miwiti ing rongan kepisan ing lapangan lan ngrampungake ing ke wolu welas. Pemain sing njupuk anteman paling sithik, utawa ayunan saka klub, kanggo ngrampungake kursus menang. Dolanan iki dilakokne ana ning ndhuwur suket, suket sing cedhak bolongan dikethok luwih cendhek lan diarani si ijo.

src: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
mt: Ilmu utamane tujuan menawa ngerti cara dunya kerja melalui metode ilmiah. Metode iki sebenere nggawe penelitian ilmiah. Metode iku ora mung, eksperimen, lan eksperimen iku tes sing digunakake kanggo nyingkirake salah sijine saka hipotesis mungkina, ngrungokake pertanyaan, lan ngobservasi uga nggawe penelitian ilmiah.
ref: Tujuan utamane ilmu sains iku kanggo nerangake kepriye cara kerjane donya iki saka metode ilmiah. Metode iki nyatane nuntun panlitian paling ilmiah. Ora mung siji kuwi, uji coba, lan uji coba yaiku cara sing digunakake kanggo mbuwang siji utawa luwih akeh hipotesis sing bisa kadadeyan, gawe pitakonan, lan gawe pengamatan uga nuntun penelitian ilmiah.

src: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
mt: Angin tornado ngguncang wewengkon sing luwih cilik tinimbang angin angin liyane sing violent, nanging bisa ngepung kabeh ing jalane. Tornado ngguncang pohon, ngguncang papan saka bangunan, lan ngguncang mobil nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggolek nggole
ref: Tornado ngrusak papan sing cilik dibandhingake karo lesus ampuh liyane, nanging iku padha bisa ngrusak apa wae ing lintasane. Lesus kuwi nyabut oyote wit-witan, nyuwek papan saka gedhung, lan ngumbulake montor menyang langit. Rong persen lesus sing paling medeni bisa kedadeyan luwih saka telung jam. Badai monster iku duwe cepet nganti 480 kilometer/jam (133 meter/detik; 300 meter per jam).

src: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
mt: Manungsa wis nggawe lan nggunakake lensa kanggo pambesaran kanggo puluhan-puluh ribu taun. Nanging, teleskop pisanan sing benar-benar digawe ing Eropa ing akir abad kaping 16. Teleskop iki nggunakake kombinasi saka loro lensa kanggo nggawe objek jauh sing kacapit banget lan luwih gedhe.
ref: Manungsa wis gawe lan migunakake lensa kanggo nggedhekake kanggo ewon-ewon taun. Ananging, teleskop tenanan kang sepisan digawe ing Eropa ing pungkasan abad 16. Teleskop- teleskop iki nggunakake gabungan loro lensa kanggo gawe objek-objek sing adoh katon luwih cerak lan gedhe.
