src: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
mt: Muhammad ngalami kepentingan sing banget ing hal-hal sing luwih saka kehidupan sing biasa. Muhammad kerap ngunjungi goa sing dikenal minangka “Hira‘” ing Gunung “Noor” (cahaya) kanggo ngadhepi. goa dhewe, sing ngalami wektu, ngilangake gambaran sing banget saka kepentingan spiritual Muhammad. Nalika duduk ing pucuk siji saka gunung-gunung lor saka Mekah, goa ora bisa diisolasi saka donya liyane. Kajaba iku, ora gampang kanggo nemokake ing pungkasan ing ngendi. Nalika ing goa, ora bisa ditepungi saka donya liyane utawa ditingali saka goa.
ref: Muhammad biyen minat banget marang perkara-perkara sing ana ing sak njabane urip ning donya iki. Dheweke asring banget menyang guwo sing saiki dikenal dadi Guwo “Hira’” ana ing Gunung “Noor” (cahya) kanggo semedi. Dheweke ing guwa dhewe, sing slamet nalika iku, menehi gambaran sing cetha banget ngenani kecenderungan spiritual Muhammad. Leren ana ning pucuk salah sawijine gunung sing ana sisih lor Mekah, guwa iki sepi banget saka donya njaba. Saktenane, ora gampang kanggo nemokake sanadyan wis ngerti anane. Sanalikane ing jero guwa, iku pengasingan total. Ora ana sing bisa ditiliki sakliyane langit sing endah, bening ana ndhuwur lan akeh gunung sakubengane. Ora akeh bageyan saka ndonya iki sing bisa dideleng utawa dirungokake saka njero guwa.

src: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
mt: Wagonways wis dibangun ing Inggris awit abad kaping 16. Walaupun wagonways mung ngandhut plang- plang paralel, kuduane kuda sing nggolekane bisa nggolekake kecepatan lan nggolekake beban sing luwih gedhe tinimbang ing jalan-jalan sing sedikit kasar ing dina. Kros-ties wis diperkenalkan awit awal kanggo nggolekake track. Nalika dina, kuduane track bakal luwih efisien karo stip iron ing pucuk. Kajaba, iron nggawe kerusakan ing roda kayu saka wagon. Akhire, roda kayu diganti karo roda iron. Ing 1767, track iron penuh kapisah wis diperkenalkan.
ref: Dalan gerobak dibangun ing Inggris paling cepet abad kaping 16. Sanajan rel sepur grobag mung kasusun saka papan kayu sing sejajar, bisa nggawe jaran narik grobag supaya bisa luwih cepet lan narik beban luwih gedhe tinimbang ing dalan sing rada kasar. Bantalan rel dikenalne rada awal kanggo nahan rel ing panggone. Nanging saya suwe, saya dimangerteni menawa rel bakal luwih efisien menawa duweni wesi ing dhuwure. Iki dadi praktik umum, nanging wesine nyebabake panganggo luwih akeh ing perangan roda kayu kreta. Pungkasan, rodha kayu diganti rodha wesi. Ing taun 1767, rel sing digawe kabeh saka wesi kapisan dikenalke.

src: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
mt: Romantisme duwe elemen gedhe saka determinisme budaya, sing dituladake saka penulis kaya Goethe, Fichte, lan Schlegel. Ing konteks romantisme, geografi nggawe individu, lan ing wektu sing padha budaya lan adat sing kaitane karo geografi iku muncul, lan kaya-kaya, sing luwih apik tinimbang hukum-hukum sing ditetepake kanthi aritmatik.
ref: Gaya sastra romantis duwe unsur determinisme budaya sing akeh, kagambar saka penulis kayata Goethe, Fichte, lan Schlegel. Ing konteks Romantisisme, geografi mbentuk individu, lan suwe-suwe adat lan budaya sing ana gandhengane karo geografi kasebut muncul, lan iki, selaras karo papan masarakat, luwih becik tinimbang ukum sing dipeksa kanthi sewenang-wenang.

src: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."
mt: Teknologi determinisme iku tembung sing ngandhut ide-ide sing luwih gedhe, saka teknologi push utawa imperatif teknologi nganti siji sing ketat sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide-ide sing ngandhut ide
ref: "Determinasi teknologi yaiku ukara sing nuduhake akeh pikiran kanggo praktek, saka dhukungan-teknologi utawa teknologi sing kudu ana nganti rasa sing kuwat yen nasib manungsa kuwi didhukung dening pikiran sing dadi dhasar dihubungke karo aturan ilmiah lan manifestasine kanggo teknologi. Umume tapsiran babagan determinisme teknologi duwe rong panemu umum: manawa pangembangan teknologi dhewe nderek jalur sing umume ora ana pangaruh budaya utawa politik, lan teknologi kasebut uga duwe ""efek"" kanggo masarakat sing nunggal, tinimbang didadekake kanthi kahanan sosial. Umpamane, ana sing bakal ngendikan yen mesin kuwi dadi cikal bakal anungsa ambangun dalan. Nanging, jaringan dalan nasional ora patut kanthi ekonomi mung kanggo sawetara mobil, mula cara produksi anyar dikembangake kanggo nyuda beya panduwe mobil. Nduweni mobil massa uga nyebabake luwih akeh kacilakan ing dalan-dalan, sing nyiptakake teknik anyar kanggo ngrumat kasarasan lan ndandani awak mobil rusak."

src: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."
mt: "Tanda ""up bow"" sing kaya V lan ""down bow mark"" sing kaya tumpukan utawa sisi bengkok sing ora ana sisi bawah. Up ngemotake kudu mulai saka ujung lan nggoleki tanda bow, lan down ngemotake kudu mulai saka kembang (sing dimanehi tanganmu nggoleki tanda bow) lan nggoleki tanda bow. Up-bow biasane ngasilake suara sing lemah, sementara down-bow kuwat lan luwih agresif. Ngeksempelake bebas nggoleki tanda bow sendiri, nanging ingkang dicetak tanda bow iku ana kanggo alasan musik, jadi biasane kudu dipertimbangkan."
ref: "Tandha ""panah dhuwur"" katon kaya huruf V lan ""tandha panah ngisor"" kaya isi staples utawa kothak sing ilang sisih ngisor. Munggah tegese sampeyan kudu miwiti saka pucuk lan nyurung gendhewa, lan mudhun tegese sampeyan kudu miwiti saka kodhok (ing ngendi tangan sampeyan nyekel gendhewa) lan narik gendhewa kasebut. Lengkungan ana ndhuwur notasi iki biyasane ngasilke swara sing luwih alus, lan tandha centhang ning ndhuwure notasi iki biyasane ngasilke swara sing luwih kuwat lan tegas. Aja mamang nulis ing tandhamu dhewe, nanging elinga tandha sudhut mlengkung sing ana amarga musik, mula biasane kudu diurmati."

src: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
mt: Kaya primata liyane, hominid ora lagi nggunakake tangan kanggo gerak utawa nggawa beban utawa nggolek ing pohon. Tangan kera sing padha karo kaki, nggambarake penggunaan tangan kanggo nggawa beban ing jalan kaki. Tangan manungsa sing luwih pendek saka kaki, karo phalanges sing luwih lurus. Tulang tangan fosil sing loro yuta nganti telu yuta taun wis ngilangake perubahan kasebut ing khususipasi tangan saka gerak menyang manipulasi.
ref: Ora kaya primata liyane, klompok hominid ora nggunakake tangane maneh kanggo obah utawa nahan barang sing abot utawa gandhulan ana ning wit-witan. Tangan lan sikil simpanse duwe ukuran lan dawa sing padha, sing nuduhake panggunaan tangan kanggo nahan bobot nalika mlaku nganggo ros-rosan driji. Tangan menungsa iku luwih cendhak tinimbang sikile, kanthi balung jenthik sing luwih lurus. Fosil balung tangan loro yuta taun tekan telung yuta taun ngatonake ewahing iki ing spesialisasi tangan iku saka daya penggerak dadi manipulasi.

src: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
mt: Penelitian abad kaping 20 ngilangake yen ana telu kolam variasi genetik: rahasia lan dinyatake. Mutasi ngambah variasi genetik anyar, lan seleksi ngilangake saka kolam variasi genetik sing dinyatake. Segregasi lan rekombinasi nggoleki variasi kembali antara telu kolam karo setiap generasi.
ref: Panliten abad rong puluhan wis nuduhake manawa ana rong kumpulan jinis genetik: didhelikake lan dituduhake. Mutasi nambah variasi genetik anyar, lan seleksi ngilangake iki saka kelompok variasi sing diungkapake. Segregasi lan rekombinasi jinis acak bolak balik antarane rong kelompok kanthi saben generasi.

src: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

Mutasi nambah variasi genetik anyar, lan seleksi ngilangake iki saka kelompok variasi sing diungkapake. Segregasi lan rekombinasi jinis acak bolak balik antarane rong kelompok kanthi saben generasi.

src: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."
mt: "Ing padhang, kanggo primata sing sistem pencernaan kaya sing kita, ora gampang kanggo ngrebutake kebutuhan asam amino saka sumber tumbuhan sing disediakake. Nanging, kegagalan kanggge ngrebutake kebutuhan asam amino iki duwe konsekuensi sing serius: depresi pertumbuhan, malnutrisi, lan akhire kematian. Sumber tumbuhan sing paling gampang diakses yaiku protein sing disediakake ing daun lan kacang, nanging iki kebalikane gampang dicerna nalika dimasak. Nanging, panganan hewan (semut, rayap, telur) ora cuman gampang dicerna, nanging uga nyediakake protein sing luwih akurat lan duwe asam amino sing esensial. Kabeh sing dianggep, kita ora kaguman kalo leluhur kita ngrebutake kebutuhan asam amino ing padhang kaya sing kera ing padhang.
ref: Ing sabana, angel kanggo primata kanthi sistem pencernaan sing kaya manungsa kanggo muasakae kebutuhan asam aminone saka sumber tanduran sing kasadhiya. Apa maneh, rasa gagal kaya ngono kuwi ngasilake perkara sing tenanan: depresi, kurang nutrisi, lan pungksane mati. Sumber daya tetanduran sing paling gampang diakses yaiku protein sing bisa dijukuk kanthi gampang ning njero godhong lan polong-polongan, nanging tetanduran iki angel banget dicerna dening primata kayata manungsa kajaba tetanduran kuwi dimasak. Sawalike, panganan kewan (semut, rayap, endhog) ora mung gampang dicerna, nanging iku nyawisake protein kualitas dhuwur sing isine kabeh asam amino sing dibutuhake. Sawise ditimbang, awake dhewe kudune ora kaget menawa leluhure awake dhewe ngatasi “masalah protein” kanthi cara sing padha karo sing dilakoni simpanse ana ing sabana dina iki.

src: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
mt: Subkultur ngumpulake individu sing mirip sing nggawe ora diakui dening standar masyarakat lan nyediakake rasa identitas. Subkultur bisa unik amarga umur, etnis, kelas, lokasi, lan/utawa gender saka anggotane. Kualitas sing nggawe subkultur unik bisa linguistik, estetik, agama, politik, seksual, geografis, utawa gabungan faktor. Anggotane subkultur umume ngasih tanda anggotane karo penggunaan gaya sing khas, sing kalebu fashon, gaya, lan argot.
ref: Cabang kabudayan ndadekake siji wong sing duwe pikiran padha sing rumangsa ora digatekake karo drajat sosial lan bisa nuwuhake rasa identitas. Cabang kabudayan bisa dibedakake amarga umur, etnis, kelas, papan, lan/utawa jenis kelamin anggota-anggotane. Kualitas sing nemtokake sawijining cabang kabudayan mbokmenawa basa, estetika, sing ana gayutane karo agama, politik, seksual, geografis, utawa sawijining kombinasi saka faktor-faktor. Anggota saka ranting budaya asring nandhani keanggotaane kanthi nggunakake gaya sing beda lan simbolis, sing kalebu busana, prilaku, lan dialek.

src: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
mt: Anak-anak ngembangake kesadaran babagan ras lan stereotip ras sing munggah munggah lan iki ngilangake perilaku. Misalé, anak-anak sing ngidhentifikasi karo ras minoritas sing di-stereotipake minangka ora sukses ing sekolah, munggah munggah ora sukses ing sekolah nalika wis ngerti babagan stereotip sing kaitane karo rasé.
ref: Anak-anak ngrembakakake sawijining kesadaran ras lan stereotip rasial iki mangaribawani tumindak. Contone, bocah sing ngenali kasukon golongan cilik sing diklisekake amarga ora bisa sekolah kanthi bener mula nyondhong ora bisa sekolah kanthi bener nalika sinau babagan klise sing ana hubungane karo suku dheweke.

mt: Anak-anak ngembangake kesadaran babagan ras lan stereotip ras sing munggah munggah lan iki ngilangake perilaku. Misalé, anak-anak sing ngidhentifikasi karo ras minoritas sing di-stereotipake minangka ora sukses ing sekolah, munggah munggah ora sukses ing sekolah nalika wis ngerti babagan stereotip sing kaitane karo rasé.
ref: Anak-anak ngrembakakake sawijining kesadaran ras lan stereotip rasial iki mangaribawani tumindak. Contone, bocah sing ngenali kasukon golongan cilik sing diklisekake amarga ora bisa sekolah kanthi bener mula nyondhong ora bisa sekolah kanthi bener nalika sinau babagan klise sing ana hubungane karo suku dheweke.

src: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."
mt: “Siji saka metode kang paling umum digunakake kanggo ngilustrasikake pentingnya sosialisasi yaiku nggunakake siji anak sing ora sosialisake dening wong (biasane wong tuwané) sementara anaké tumbuh. Anak-anak sing ora sosialisake kaya iki diarani “feral” utawa liar. Siji feral anak bisa ditahan déning wong (biasane wong tuwané) amarga wong tuwané ora ngerti anaké sing cacat mental utawa fisik. Feral anak bisa ngerasa kasusahan utawa trauma sadurungé diasingake utawa ngeblug. Anak-anak liya diarani wis dibesarkan déning woh-wohan; siji diarani wis urip ing alam bebas tanpa wong. Nalika wis dibesarkan déning woh-wohan, anak-anak feral ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fisik) ngilu (dalam batas fis
ref: Salah sawijine metode sing paling umum digunakake kanggo nggambarake pentinge sosialisasi yaiku manfaatke kasus-kasus sing kurang nguntungke bocah-bocah sing, ora dianggep, mesakke, sengaja disalahgunakke, ora diajak rembugan dening wong diwassa nalika isih cilik. Anak-anak kaya iku disebut “liar” utawa nakal. Saperangan anak- anak liar uwis dikurung dening wong-wong (biasane uwong tuwane dhewe); ing saperangan kasus anak-anak iki ditelantarke amarga penolakane uwong tuwa marang kerusakan intelektual utawa fisike anak sing parah. Bocah nakal kuwi bisa uga wis tau dianiaya nalika isih bocah utawa rasa wedi sadurunge ditinggal utawa sadurunge minggat. Liyane dikira digawa kewan; saperangan disebutake urip dhewe ing alam liar. Nalika dirawat dening kean dudu-manungsa, si anak nuduhake tumindak sing liar (kanthi watesan tartamtu) meh kabeh kaya perawatan kewan utamane, kayata rasa wedi lan uga rasa ora pedhuline marang manungsa.

src: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
mt: Subsistence agriculture yaiku pertanian sing dilakokake kanggo ngasilake cukup panganan kanggo nggawe mung kebutuhan panganan saka pertanian lan kulawargane. Subsistence agriculture yaiku sistem sederhana, kadang-kadang organik, sing nggunakake benih sing disimpen asli saka ecoregion kasebut digabungake karo rotasi tanaman utawa teknik liyane sing mung nggawe maksimal hasil. Historisake paling akèh petani sing nyengkuyung ing subsistence agriculture lan iki isih dadi kasus ing akèh negara-negara sing ngalami.
ref: Tetanen swasembada yaiku tetanen sing ditindakake kanggo ngasilake panganan sing cukup kanggo nyukupi kabutuhan wong tani lan kulawargane. Tetanen panguripan minangka cara sing gampang, asring organik, nggunakake wiji sing asli disimpen kanggo ecoregion sing digabungake karo rotasi panen utawa cara sing gampang kanggo nggedhekake. Sarasilah umume uwong tani akeh melu tetanen panguripan lan iki isih kedadeyan ing pirang-pirang negara berkembang.

src: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
mt: Wisata paling umum yaiku sing paling akèh wong ngasokake: Wisata rekreasi. Iki yaiku nalika wong nggoleki wektu sing béda saka uripé wong-wong sing padha dadi rileks lan seneng. Pantai, taman tema lan camp ground yaiku sing paling akèh sing diakses déning wong-wong sing wisata. Jika tujuan siji saka kunjungan wong-wong ing wektu sing béda saka uripé wong-wong sing padha dadi rileks lan seneng. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
ref: Mungkin jenis turisme sing paling umum yaiku apa sing saperangan akeh wong-wong gayutake karo lelungan: Wisata rekreasi. Iki wayahe wong lunga menyang panggon sing beda banget karo urip saben dinane supaya bisa leyeh-leyeh lan seneng-seneng. Pesisir, taman rekreasi lan papan kemah iku kerepe panggon-panggon kang paling lumrah ditekani dening turis rekreasi. Yen tujuan utamane wong sing dolan menyang panggonan tartamtu kuwi kanggo mangerteni sejarah lan kabudayane jinis plesiran sing kaya mangkene iki diarani plesiran kabudayan. Turis kuwi bisa plesir menyang tandha sing khas ana negara tartamtu utawa turis kuwi bisa milih supaya mung nggatekake sak panggonan thok.

src: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
mt: Orang-orang sing wis ngelakoni kanggo bebrayan dekade ngilangake kasebut ngilangake kekuwatan lan kekawanan sing kagolongake kanthi nggolongake kegagalan. Sementara nggolongake individu nggolongake keluarga lan organisasi nggolongake, kasebut nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake nggolongake ng
ref: Wong-wong sing wis melu kanggo sawetara dasawarsa ngewangi awake dhewe ngajeni kakuwatan lan semangate dhewe nalika ngukur angele lan uga gagale kanthi jujur. Nalika ngrungokake saben wong nuduhake crita pribadi, kulawarga, lan pakumpulan, kita entuk wawasan sing penting ing mangsa kepungkur lan sawetara kapribaden sing mangaruhi kabecikan utawa ala budaya pakumpulan. Nalika ngerti sarasilahe wong aja nganggep ngerti budayane, paling ora mbantu masarakat entuk pangerten ing pundi dheweke ana ing sarasilah pakumpulan. Nalika ngevaluasi kesuksesan lan dadi sadhar marang kegagalan, individu lan kabeh wong sing melu nemokake kanthi luwih jero nilai-nilai, misi, lan kekuatan pendhorong organisasi. Ing perkara iki, ngeling-eling prilaku wirausaha sing sadurunge lan asile bisa mbantu supaya manungsa bisa nrima owah-owahan anyar lan uga dalan anyar kanggo gereja lokal iki. Crita sukses kaya mengkono nyuda rasa wedi marang perubahan, semono uga gawe kecenderungan positif tumrap perubahan ing mangsa ngarep.

src: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
mt: Pendekatan pasca-modern menyangkut belajar ngilangake kebebasan saka absolut. Ana ora siji cara bagus kanggo belajar. Kajaba ana ora siji hal bagus kanggo belajar.Belajar dumadi ing pengalaman antara pelajar lan pengetahuan sing disajekake. Pengalaman saiki kita karo kabeh do-it-yourself lan informasi nampilake, belajar televisi ngilangake titik iki. Akèh saka kita sing menyangkutake televisi sing nampilake proses utawa pengalaman ing kana kita ora bakal nglakokake utawa ngaplikasake pengetahuan. Kita ora bakal ngilangake mobil, ngilangake sumber ing taman ing belakang, ngelintang menyang Peru kanggo ngrusak reruntuhan sing kuna, utawa ngrembaka rumah tetangga.
ref: Cara nyedhaki nalika wis moderen, kanggo nyinau nawakke kabebasan saka sing mutlak. Ora ana cara sing apik kanggo sinau. Saktemene, ora ana perkara apik siji thk sing bisa disinau. SInau kelakon ing pengalaman antarane wong sinau lan wawasan sing disuguhake. Pangalaman kita saiki karo kabeh presentasi babagan nggawe-dhewe lan katrangan, acara TV adhedhasar piwulang nggambarake bab iki. Akeh banget saka awake dhewe sing nonton acara TV sing nuduhake awake dhewe proses utawa pengalaman ing ngendi awake dhewe ora bakal ngeloni utawa nganggo wawasan kasebut. Awake dhewe ora bakal mbongkar mobil, mbangun pancuran ing latar mburi omahe dhewe, lunga menyang Peru kanggo mariksa jugrugan kuno, utawa model ulang omahe tangga.

SInau kelakon ing pengalaman antarane wong sinau lan wawasan sing disuguhake. Pangalaman kita saiki karo kabeh presentasi babagan nggawe-dhewe lan katrangan, acara TV adhedhasar piwulang nggambarake bab iki. Akeh banget saka awake dhewe sing nonton acara TV sing nuduhake awake dhewe proses utawa pengalaman ing ngendi awake dhewe ora bakal ngeloni utawa nganggo wawasan kasebut. Awake dhewe ora bakal mbongkar mobil, mbangun pancuran ing latar mburi omahe dhewe, lunga menyang Peru kanggo mariksa jugrugan kuno, utawa model ulang omahe tangga.

src: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
mt: Sleep interruption iku proses nggawe awak sadar nalika periode tidur normal lan banjur tidur saka 10-60 menit. Iki bisa dilakokake kanthi nggawe alarm kunci sing ora rame supaya awak sadar tanpa benar-benar bangun. Jika awak nggawe alarm kunci ing tidur, bisa dipindahake ing sisi liyane saka ruangan, nggawe awak keluar saka ranjang supaya bisa ngeculake.
ref: Gangguan turu iku proses sing sengaja nangekake nalika wayah turu normal sampeyan lan bali turu maneh ora sawetara wektu (10-60 menit) Iki bisa ditindakake kanthi gampang kanthi nggunakake jam beker sing rada amleng sing bisa gawe sampeyan sadar tanpa tangi nganti kaget. Yen sampeyan nemokake awake sampeyan ngatur ulang jam ing tilem sampeyan, iku bisa dipapanake ing sisih liya kamar, meksa sampeyan tangi saka panggonan kanggo mateni iku. Pilihan adhedhasar bioritme liyane yaiku ngombe banyu akeh (utamane banyu utawa teh, dikenal minangka kanggo wetokake akeh uyuh) sadurunge turu, meksa wong tangi kanggo nguyuh.

src: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
mt: Beberapa wong percaya menawa pengalaman banyane mimpi lucid sing disengaja sering banget bisa banget nggawa kelelahan. Alasane utama kanggo fenomena iki yaiku hasil saka mimpi lucid sing nggawe panjang wektu antara REM negara. Dengan REM sing kurang banget per malam, negara sing nyata ing endi kalian pengalaman tidur lan awak kalian ngrenggah banget dadi kurang banget banget supaya dadi masalah. Kajaba kajaba kelelahan kaya ing endi kalian bangun saben 20 utawa 30 menit lan nonton TV. Pengaruh iki tergantung banget karo saben-saben kapan otak kalian nggawe mimpi lucid banget per malam.
ref: Sawetara wong percaya menawa ngalami ngimpi jelas kang diinduksi kanthi gaweyan asring bisa marakake kesel. Alesan utama fenomena iki minangka asil kondisi impen sadhar sing njembarake dawane wektu ing antarane kondisi REM. Kanthi REM sing luwih sithik saben wengine, kahanan iki ing ngendi sampeyan ngalami turu temenan lan awak sampeyan leren dadi cukup arang kanggo dadi masalah. Iki padha kesele kaya-kaya sampeyan nglilir saben rong puluh utawa telung puluh menit lan nonton TV. Asile gumantung saka asringe utek sampeyan ngimpi kanthi jelas saben wengi.

src: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
mt: Tim virtual dituntut menurut standar keunggulan sing padha karo tim konvensional, nanging ana perbedaan-perbedaan sing halus. Anggota tim virtual umume berfungsi minangka titik kontak kanggo grup fisik sing langsung. Mereka umume duwe otonomi sing luwih saka anggota tim konvensional amarga tim sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana nyata (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) sing ora ana
ref: Regu virtual duwe pathokan keunggulan sing padha karo regu konvensional, nanging ana beda sing ora ketara. Anggota tim virtual asring dadi titik kontak kanggo klompok fisik langsunge. Dheweke asring duwe otonomi luwih tinimbang anggota regu biyasa amarga regune bisa ketemu karo macem-macem tlatah wektu sing bisa uga ora dingerteni karo pangurus enggonan. Anane “tim ora katon” sing temenan (Larson lan LaFasto, 1989, p109) uga komponen sing unik saka tim virtual. Tim sing ora katon yaiku tim manajemen sing saben anggotane laporan. Tim sing ora katon netepake standar kanggo saben anggota.

src: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
mt: Teori konten ana ing panyerona apa sing nggawe manungsa nggugah utawa nggabut. Teori-teori iki ngajokake manungsa duwe kebutuhan lan/utawa keinginan sing wis diinternalisasi nalika mateng dadi wong dewasa. Teori-teori iki ngrunjuke apa sing kaitane karo wong-wong sing nggawe manungsa kudu lan apa sing ing lingkungan sing nggawe manungsa nggawe utawa ora nggawe manungsa nggawe utawa ora nggawe manungsa nggawe. Dwi teori konten sing populer yaiku Teori Piranti Maslow lan Teori Dwi Piranti Hertzberg.
ref: Teori konten dadi pusat kanggo nemokake apa sing ndadekake wong milih utawa narik kawigaten. Teori kasebut nuduhake menawa uwong duwe kabutuhan lan/utawa kepinginan tartamtu sing uwis diinternalisasi nalika dheweke mlebu mosok diwasa. Teori-teori iki ngamati ana apa karo wong-wong tartamtu sing marakake dheweke kepengin apa sing dilakoni lan apa perkara ing lingkungne sing bakal marakake dheweke kanggo nglakoni utawa ora nglakoni tumindak tartamtu. Loro teori isi sing misuwur yaiku Teori Kebutuhan HIerarki Maslow lan Teori Faktor Loro Hertzberg.

src: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
mt: Aturan sing sering dihina lan kadang-kadang diolokake, aturan tiga saka tiga iku siji panduan sing sederhana ngegawe dinamika sarta ngendalikan ukuran ing gambar. Iki nyatake yèn tempat sing paling efektif kanggo subjek utama yaiku ing persilangan antara garis sing ngubungake gambar dadi tiga saka tiga vertikal lan horizontal (lihat conto).
ref: Aturan kaping telu sing paling asring-dilecehke iku panduan sing sederhana nalika nyiptakake dinamisme kanthi uga njaga rasa tertib ana njero gambar. Iki nuduhake menawa papan sing paling efektif kanggo subyek utama yaiku ing persimpangan garis sing mbagi gambar dadi telu kanthi vertikal lan horisontal (delok contone).

src: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
mt: Conto, format gambar statis paling umum ing donya iki yaiku 35mm, sing dadi ukuran film dominan ing pungkasan era film analog. Iki isih diprodhuksi saiki, nanging ing ngisor-asing, aspek rasioning iki wis diwarisi dening format sensor kamera digital. Format 35mm iki yaiku, kurang-lebih, 36mm ing wulu lan 24mm ing tinggi. Aspek rasioning iki (dibagi karo 12 kanggo ngasilake aspek rasioning sederhana) yaiku 3:2. Format umum (APS keluarga format, misale, sing padha utawa nggampangake aspek rasioning iki.
ref: Tuladhane, format potograpi gambar mati sing umum ing donya yaiku 35mm, ing ngendi iku ukuran film sing dominan ing pungkasane jaman film analog. Iku isih diprodhuksi dina iki, nanging sing luwih penting rasio aspek wis diwarisake dening format sensor gambar kamera digital. 35mm iku arupa sejatine, rada bingung, ambane 36mm lan 24mm. Tentandhingan aspek format iki (kaperang kanthi rolas kanggo ngasilake tetandhingan angka sing paling prasaja) mula saka iku disebutake 3:2. Format kang luwih umum (contone, format saka kaluwarga APS) iku padh utawa nyedhaki rasio aspek iki.

src: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
mt: Kekurangan lensa zoom yaiku yèn kompleksitas fokus lan jumlah elemen lensa sing diperlukan kanggo nggawe jangkauan fokus sing luwih gedhe tinimbang lensa sing fokus tetep. Kekurangan iki mulane nggawe lensa zoom bisa nggawe gambar sing kualitas sing padha karo sing dicapai dening lensa sing fokus tetep. Kekurangan liyane saka lensa zoom yaiku yèn maksimum bukaan (kecepatan) lensa biasane luwih cilik. Kekurangan iki nggawe lensa zoom sing murah bisa dadi nggawe nggunakake ing kondisi cahya sing kurang tanpa flash.
ref: Kakurangane lensa kanggo nggedhekake yaiku karuwetan fokus lan jumlah elemen lensa sing dibutuhne kanggo ngentukne kisaran dawane fokus iku luwih gedhe tinimbang kanggo lensa utama. Iki dadi sethithik perkara nalika pabrik lensa entuk standar sing luwih dhuwur sajrone ngasilake lensa. Iki gawe lensa zoom bisa gawe gambar sing apik sing bisa dibandhingke karo lensa sing dawane fokus tetep. Kapitunan liya saka lensa zoom iku menawa celah maksimal (kecepatan) saka lensa iku biasane luwih rendah. Iki nggawe lensa zoom rega murah angel digunakake ing kahanan cahya sing sithik tanpa sumunar.

src: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

ref: Mistisisme yaiku nggayuh sesrawungan karo, identitas karo, utawa karumangsan kasunyatan sing dhuwur, ketuhanan, bebener rohani, utawa Tuhan. Para panganut ngupaya pangalaman langsung, gruneking ati, utawa wawasan babagan kasunyatan/dewa utawa dewa-dewa. Para pandherek nguyak cara-cara urip tertamtu, utawa latihan sing dikarepake kanggo ngrumat pengalaman-pengalaman. Kapercayan klenik bisa dibedhakake saka bentuk liya saka kapercayan agama lan pangibadahan kanthi penekanane marang pengalaman dhewe langsung saka kahanan kesadharan sing mbedani, utamane karakter sing ayem, duwe wawasan, tentrem, malah uga nyenengake.

Para panganut ngupaya pangalaman langsung, gruneking ati, utawa wawasan babagan kasunyatan/dewa utawa dewa-dewa. Para pandherek nguyak cara-cara urip tertamtu, utawa latihan sing dikarepake kanggo ngrumat pengalaman-pengalaman. Kapercayan klenik bisa dibedhakake saka bentuk liya saka kapercayan agama lan pangibadahan kanthi penekanane marang pengalaman dhewe langsung saka kahanan kesadharan sing mbedani, utamane karakter sing ayem, duwe wawasan, tentrem, malah uga nyenengake.

src: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
mt: Ora wae ing abad kaping 19 lan 20, dipercaya wong pertama sing ngginakake Selandia Baru yaiku warga Maori sing ngejar burung gedhe sing diarani moa. Teori sing diwujudake ide sing warga Maori sing migas saka Polynesia ing Great Fleet lan ngambil Selandia Baru saka Moriori, nggawe sawijining masyarakat pertanian. Nanging, bukti anyar ngandharake wong Moriori yaiku grup warga Maori sing migas saka Selandia Baru menyang Pulau Chatham, nggawe budaya sing khas lan damai. Uga ana suku liyane ing pulau Chatham iki warga Maori sing migas saka Selandia Baru. Warga Maori ngarani Moriori, ana sedikit perkelahian lan ing pungkasan, Moriori dihapus
ref: Kanggo wektu sing suwe sasuwene abad kaping sangalas lan rongpuluh, iku dipercaya warga sepisan ing Selandia Baru iku wong-wong Maori, sing mburu manuk raseksa sing diarani moas. Ajaran iki banjur netepake ide manawa wong-wong Maori pindah saka Polinesia ing Great Fleet lan njupuk Selandia Baru saka Moriori, dadi masarakat tetanen. Nanging, bukti anyar nuduhake yen Moriori minangka pepanthan dharatan Maori sing pindah saka New Zealand menyang Kapuloan Chatham, ngembangake kabudayan sing khas lan tentrem. Ana ing pulo Chatam uga ana suku liyane yaiku suku Maori sing ngalih saka Selandia Baru. Dheweke padha ngarani dheweke dhewe Moriori ana sawetara paprangan cilik lan ing pungkasane, Moriori musnah.

src: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
mt: Origami Pureland yaiku origami kanthi restriksi sing ora bisa dilakokake siji lipatan sajone, lipatan sing luwih kompleks kaya balik lipatan ora diijinkake, lan kabeh lipatan duwe lokasi sing langsung. Iki diwutahake dening John Smith ing taun 1970-an kanggo ngrembakaake folder sing ora ngerti utawa sing duwe kemampuan motor sing terbatas.
ref: Origami Pureland yaiku origami kanthi wates mung saklempitan sing oleh dilakoni saben wektu, lempitan kang luwih ruwet kaya lempitan walik ora diolehne, lan kabeh lempitan duwe panggonan sing langsung. John Smith ngembangke nalika taun 1970an kanggo nulung berkas tanpa pengalaman utawa wong-wong sing nduweni watesan katrampilan motorik.

src: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
mt: Peradaban Indus Valley iku peradaban perunggu ing subbenua India kidul-kidul ing ngendi peradaban iki ngremuk ing wates Indus lan ing ngendi peradaban iki uga ana ing wates Sarasvati sing kini wis kering, amarga peradaban iki kagolongake ing wates Indus, nanging ana uga sing ngarani peradaban iki peradaban Harappan amarga Harappa iku situs peradaban iki sing pisanan diangkat ing taun 1920-an.
ref: Kabudayan Lembah Indus iku kabudayan Jaman Perunggu ning anak benua India sisih lor kulon kalebu nganti-saiki. Pakistan lan daerah-daerah ing wilayah iki lan uga Afganistan sisih lor wetan. Kasusilan megar ing cekungan Kali Indus lan mula jenenge dijupuk. Sanadyan ana ahli sing ngira-ngira yen wiwitane kabudayan uga ana cekungan saka Kali Saraswati sing saiki garing, kudune kuwi diarani kanthi cetho Kabudayan Indus-Saraswati, nanging ana uga sing ngarani Kabudayan Harappan dijukuk saka Harappa, sing diduduk kaping pisan saka panggonan liyane taun 1920an.

src: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
mt: Kerakusan lan egoisme bakal selalu ana lan iku saka sifat kerja sama sing kala ora ana sing bakal dadi manfaat kanggo kabeh sing bakal dadi manfaat sing luwih gedhe ing jangka wanci sing luwih pendek kanthi nggawe egoisme. Semoga, kabeh wong bakal ngerti yen pilihan sing paling apik kanggo kabeh sing bakal dadi manfaat sing luwih gedhe ing jangka wanci sing luwih dawa ya iku kerja sama karo wong liyane.
ref: Rasa serakah lan pengin menang dhewe iku bakal mesthi ana ning njero awake dhewe lan iki dadi sipat kanggo makarya bareng yaiku yen kita wis nduweni kabeh kauntungan gedhe isih ana akeh banget sing bisa jukuk kanthi cepet nalika nduweni rasa kepingin menang dhewe. Muga-muga akeh wong ngerteni manawa pilihan jangka dawa paling apik yaiku makarya kanthi bebarengan.

src: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
mt: Kasuslahan perang U.S. imperialisme ing penaklukan Filipina di bayar dening rakyat Filipina sendiri. Mereka dipaksa nggawe pajak marang rejim kolonial AS kanggo nggawa bagian gedhe saka kasuslahan lan bunga saham sing diayari dening pamarintah Filipina ing Wall Street bank. Tentu, keuntungan super sing dihasilake saka eksploitasi panjang rakyat Filipina bakal nggawe keuntungan utama U.S. imperialisme.
ref: Biaya perang saka imperialisme Amerika ing penaklukan Filipina dibayar dening wong Filipino dhewe. Dheweke dipeksa mbayar pajeg ing pamrentahan kolonial A.S. kanggo mbeyani blanja negara sing akeh lan bunga obligasi ngambang angge jenengb pamrentah Filipina liwat omah bank Wall Street. Mesthi wae, untung gedhe sing asale saka eksploitase sing suwe marang wong Filipina bakal dadi keuntungan dhasar saka imperialisme Amerika.

src: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
mt: Agama Templar bisa dipahami nalika ngerti konteks sing nggawe ordo. Waktu sing nggawe peristiwa iki umume diarani Zaman Tinggi Abad Pertengahan, periode sejarah Eropa ing abad ke-11, ke-12, lan ke-13 (AD 1000–1300). Zaman Tinggi Abad Pertengahan diwatesi dening Zaman Abad Pertengahan Awal lan diwatesi dening Zaman Abad Pertengahan Akhir, sing umume diwatesi ing sekitar 1500.
ref: Kanggo ngerteni Templars, wong kudu ngerti kahanan sing nyurung kanggo nggawe tatanan kasebut. Jaman nalika anane kadadean-kadadean biasa diarani Jaman Pertengahan Dhuwur wayah ing sejarah Eropa ing abad ke 11, 12, lan 13 (AD 1000-1300) Pertengahan Abad Dhuwur didhisiki kanthi Wiwitan Abad Pertengahan lan disusul kanthi Pungkasan Abad Pertengahan, sing miturut konvensi pungkasan watara 1500.

src: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
mt: Kasugihan militernya Kekaisaran Romawi nggawa ing pambangunan saka kemajuan medis. Dokter mulai di rekrutake dening Kaisar Agustus lan bahkan nggawe Korps Medis Romawi pertama kanggo digunakake ing sawise perang. Dokter wis ngerti ngeni berbagai sedatif kalebu morfin saka ekstrak biji papaya lan skopolamin saka biji herbane. Mereka dadi ahli ing amputasi kanggo ngurangi pasien saka gangren saka tourniquet lan klamphe sirkulasi kanggo ngendheg aliran getih. Nalika wektu sing padha, Kekaisaran Romawi nggawa ing kemajuan sing gedhe ing bidang medis lan nggawe kabeh sing kita kenal saiki.
ref: Sipat militer kerajaan Roma ditulungi dening carane nggedekake kasihatane. Dokter-dokter wiwit direkrut dening Kaisar Augustus lan bahkan mbentuk Kesatuan Medis Romawi kang sepisan kang dinggo sawise perang. Ahli bedhah duwe kawruh babagan maneka warna obat pengurang nyeri kalebu morfin saka ekstrak wiji apiun lan skopolamin saka wiji herbana. Dheweke dadi ahli amputasi kanggo nylametake pasien saka sel sing mati uga kaya turniket lan klem arteri kanggo mbendhung getih sing mlaku. Luwih saka sawetara abad, kerajaan Roma mimpin menyang panemon kang gedhe ing babagan obat lan mbentuk akeh saka wawasan kang awake dhewe ngerteni saiki.

src: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
mt: Vision, utawa kemampuan nglihat tergantung sistem sensor visual utawa mata. Ana banyake konstruksi mata, mulai saka sederhana nganti kompleks, tergantung karepéa organisme. Konstruksi-konstruksi kaya iki berbeda, sensitif terhadap gelombang-gelombang berbeda lan punika berbeda derajat kejelasan, uga mereka memerlukan proses berbeda untuk membuat arti masuk dan jumlah berbeda untuk bekerja secara optimal.
ref: Pandhangan, utawa kakuwatan kanggo ndeleng gumantung marang organ sistem sensor pandhangan utawa mata. Ana akeh susunan mata, kang beda-beda, wiwit saka karuwetan gumantung karo kabutuhan makluk. Pambangunan sing beda-beda duwe macem-macem katrampilan, preduli marang dawane gelombang sing beda-beda lan duwe tingkat kalandhepan sing beda-beda, uga mbutuhake pangolahan sing beda kanggo ngerteni macem-macem input lan nomer supaya bisa digunakake kanthi apik.

src: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."
mt: "Sikhisme iku agama saka sub-kontinen India. Iki asal saka wilayah Punjab ing abad kaping 15 saka pambagian sekta saka tradisi Hindu. Sikh ngertemake agamane iku agama saka saka Hindu nanging dheweke ngakoni tradisi Hindu lan saka saka. Sikh ngarani agamane iku Gurmat, sing Punjabi kanggo ""jalan guru"". Guru iku aspek fundamental saka kabeh agama India nanging ing Sikhisme iku guru duwe pentingan sing ngemot inti saka kepercayaan Sikh. Agama iku didirikan ing abad kaping 15 dening Guru Nanak (1469-1539). ref: Sikhisme kuwi agama saka anak benua India. Asline kabentuk ana ing daerah Punjab ana abad 15 saka anane rasa ora seneng ing njero tradisi agama Hindu. Sikh nganggep imane dheweke padha dadi agama sing kapisah saka agama Hindu sanajan dheweke padha ngakoni iku sumber-sumber lan tradhisi-tradhisi Hindu. Para sikh ngarani agamane Gurmat, yaiku tembung Punjabi kanggo “dalane guru”. Guru iki asepek dhasar saka kabeh agama ing India nanging Sikhisme nganggep kuwi penting sing mbentuk inti saka kepercayaane sikh. Agama iki diadegaké ing abad ka-15 dening Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Ing kana disusul ing sanga guru sabanjure.

src: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."
mt: "Sikhisme iku agama saka sub-kontinen India. Iki asal saka wilayah Punjab ing abad kaping 15 saka pambagian sekta saka tradisi Hindu. Sikh ngertemake agamane iku agama saka saka Hindu nanging dheweke ngakoni tradisi Hindu lan saka saka. Sikh ngarani agamane iku Gurmat, sing Punjabi kanggo ""jalan guru"". Guru iku aspek fundamental saka kabeh agama India nanging ing Sikhisme iku guru duwe pentingan sing ngemot inti saka kepercayaan Sikh. Agama iku didirikan ing abad kaping 15 dening Guru Nanak (1469-1539). src: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."
mt: Kesalahan Perhatian ""adalah sindrom neurologis yang klasik triad definisi termasuk impulsivitas, kegagalan untuk memperhatikan, dan keaktifan atau energi berlebihan"". Ia bukan kecacatan belajar, ia adalah gangguan belajar; itu ""mengganggu 3 hingga 5 persen dari semua anak-anak, mungkin sebanyak 2 juta anak Amerika"". Anak-anak dengan ADD memiliki sulit untuk memfokuskan pada hal-hal seperti pekerjaan sekolah, tetapi mereka dapat berkonsentrasi pada hal-hal yang mereka sukai melakukan seperti bermain permainan atau menonton kartun favorit mereka atau menulis kalimat tanpa tanda baca. Anak-anak ini cenderung masuk ke dalam banyak masalah, karena mereka ""berpartisipasi dalam perilaku berisiko, masuk ke dalam pertarungan, dan menantang otoritas"" untuk merangsang otak mereka, karena otak mereka tidak dapat merangsang dengan metode normal. ADD mempengaruhi hubungan dengan teman-teman lainnya karena anak-anak lain tidak dapat memahami mengapa mereka bertindak seperti mereka lakukan atau mengapa mereka menulis mereka lakukan atau bahwa tingkat kematangan mereka berbeda."
ref: "Cacad Kakurangan Perhatosan ""minangka sindrom neurologis sing telung gejala klasik kalebu impulsif, reribed, lan hiperaktif utawa tenaga sing luwih-luwih"". Iki menawa dudu ora bisa sinau, iku reribed sinau; iku ""mangaruhi 3 nganti 5 persen saka kabeh bocah, bisa uga ana 2 yuta bocah-bocah Amerika"". Bocah kanthi ADD susah kanggo fokus marang perkara-perkara kaya tugas sekolah, nanging bocah kuwi bisa konsentrasi menyang perkara sing seneng dilakoni kaya dolanan game utawa nonton kartun kasenengane utawa nulis ukara tanpa tandha. Bocah-bocah kasebut ndhoyong ngalami akeh masalah, amarga ""nduwe tumindak pituna, gelut, lan nantang panguwasa"" kanggo ngrangsang utek, amarga uteke ora bisa dirangsang dening cara biyasa. ADD mangaruhi sambungan karo kanca-kanca liyane amarga bocah liya ora ngerti geneya dheweke tumindak kaya ngono utawa geneya dheweke ngeja kaya ngono apa utawa dheweke duwe tingkat kadiwasan sing beda."

src: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
mt: Kajian berbasis proyek bisa nggawe belajar luwih gampang lan luwih menarik, tetapi scaffolding nganti langkah saka. Scaffolding ora metode belajar nanging bantuan sing nyediakake dukungan kanggo individu sing ngalami pengalaman belajar anyar kaya nggunakake program komputer anyar utawa ngawit proyek anyar. Scaffolds bisa dadi virtual lan nyata, ing sajeroning sajeroning, guru minangka bentuk scaffolding nanging sajeroning sajeroning, kancang kertas sing padha ing Microsoft Office. Scaffolds virtual diinternalisasi ing software lan diharapake ngrungokake, nggawe, lan ngajari prosedur sing bisa dadi terlalu nggawe murid nggawe sendiri.
ref: Nalika pasinaon adhedhasar proyek kudune gawe pasinaon luwih gampang lan luwih narik, perancah sejangkah luwih adoh. Scaffolding dudu cara sinau nanging pitulung sing menehi dhukungan kanggo tiyang sing duweni pangalaman anyar sinau kayata nggunakake program komputer anyar utawa miwiti proyek anyar. Perancah bisa dadi virtual lan nyata, kanthi tembung liya, guru minangka bentuk perancah nanging uga paperclip cilik sing ana ing Microsoft Office. Perancah Virtual diinternalisasi ing piranti lunak lan ditujokake kanggo takon, njaluk, lan nerangake tata cara sing bisa nantang murid supaya bisa nangani dhewe.

src: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
mt: MySpace iku situs ketiga sing paling populer sing digunakake ing Amerika Sarékat lan duwe 54 juta profil saiki. Situs iki wis ngalami perhatian sing akèh, khusus ing setting pendidikan. Ana aspek positif ing situs iki, sing kalebu, bisa gampang ngaturakake laman kelas sing bisa kalebu blog, video, foto, lan fitur liyane. Laman iki bisa gampang diakses kanthi nggawa siji alamat situs, sing nggawe gampang diingat lan gampang ditulisi kanggo siswa sing bisa ngalami masalah nganggo keyboard utawa karo ejaan. Iki bisa di-customize supaya gampang dibaca lan uga kanthi warna kaya sing dikehendaki.
ref: MySpace minangka tapak web paling misuwur nomer telu sing digunakake ing Amerika Serikat lan saiki duwe 54 yuta lelakon. Akeh banget sing nggatekke situs web iki, utamane kanggo sinau. Ana aspek positif kanggo situs web iki, sing kalebu, bisa ngatur latar kelas kanthi gampang sing uga kalebu blog, video, poto, lan liya-liyane. Halaman iki bisa gampang dileboni kanthi mung menehi siji tetenger web, sing gampang dieling-eling lan gampang diketik kanggo murid sing bisa kangelan nggunakake papan ketik utawa nganggo tatananing panulis. Iku bisa dijumbuhake kanggo gawe iki gampang diwaca lan uga kanthi saakeh utawa sethithik werna kaya sing dipingini.

src: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
mt: Kanthi wektu Juni 1956, janji Krushchev diuji nalika aksi ing Polandia, sing wong kerja nglawan kekurangan pangan lan potong gaji, berubah dadi protes umum menawa komunisme. Walaupun akhire, Krushchev ngejutakake tank kanggo ngrenggahaken ketatanegaraan, dheweke ngelembakake pangajab ekonomi lan setuju nggawe Wladyslaw Gomulka minangka perdana menteri anyar.
ref: Nanging, ing Juni 1956, janji-janji Krushchev diuji nalika karusuhan ing Polandia, ing ngendi para buruh protes babagan kakurangan pangan lan sudane opah, malih dadi protes umum ngelawan komunisme. Sanadyan ing pungkasane, Krushchev ngirim tank kanggo mbalekne kahanan, dheweke nyerah karo sawetara panjalukan ekonomi lan setuju kanggo nunjuk Wladyslaw Gomulka sing misuwur dadi perdana menteri anyar.

src: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
mt: Jerman dadi musuh umum ing Perang Donya 2, nggawe kerja sama antarane Uni Soviet lan Amerika Serikat. Nalika perang wis beres, konflik antarane sistem, proses lan budaya nggawe negara-negara nggawa. Dua taun sawise perang beres, musuh-musuh saka perang beres wis dadi musuh lan Perang Dingin beres. Iki bakal berlangsung kanggo 40 taun pungkasan lan bakal dadi dipertahankan kanggo nyata, dening tentara-tentara proxy, ing medan perang saka Afrika nganti Asia, ing Afghanistan, Kuba lan tempat-tempat liyane.
ref: Jerman iku mungsuh bebarengan ing perang Donya 2, marakake kerjasama antarane Uni Soviet lan Amerika Serikat. Karo pungkasane perang, bentrokan sistem, proses lan budaya marakake negara-negara rubuh. Kanthi pungkasan perang rong taun kepungkur, mantan sekuton saiki dadi mungsuh lan Perang Dingin diwiwiti. Iki bakal ana nganti 40 tahun mengarep lan bakal diperjuangake kanthi temen, dening tentara sing kuasa, ing medan perang saka Afrika tekan Asia, Afganistan, Kuba lan akeh papan liyane.

src: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
mt: Sistem Saraf ngatur homeostasis dening ngelemparkan impuls saraf ing seluruh awak kanggo ngecakake aliran darah ingkang kagolongan sarta ora kacathet. Impuls-impuls saraf iki bisa lemparkan kanthi cepet ing awak ingkang ngilangake awak saka ancaman potensial.
ref: Sistem Saraf njaga homeostatis kanthi ngirim impulse saraf liwat sakabehane awak kanggo njaga ilining getih lancar kaya tanpa gangguan. Rangsangan saraf iki bisa disalurke kanthi cepet banget menyang awak sing bisa njaga awak saka anceman sing bisa nyerang awak.

src: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."
mt: "Piramid Ageng ing Giza yaiku satunggaling saka tujuh keajaiban sing isih ana ing saiki. Dibangun dening Mesir ing abad kaping tiga SM, Piramid Ageng yaiku satunggaling saka piramid gedhé sing dibangun kanggo ngormati Pharaoh mati. Plateau Giza, utawa "Giza Necropolis" ing lemah Mesir Valley saka mati ngandhut piramid (saka piramid gedhé yaiku gedhé dhéwé), piramid cilik, tembok, lan Sphinx gedhé. Piramid ageng dibangun kanggo ngormati Pharaoh Khufu, lan piramid, tembok, lan tembok cilik dibangun kanggo ngormati Khufu wong lan anggota kulawarga."
ref: Piramida Agung ing Giza minangka salah sawijining pitu kaelokan sing isih ana nganti saiki. Dibangun dening wong Mesir ing abad kaping telu SM, Piramida Gedhe yaiku salah siji saka sakehing struktur piramida sing dibangun kanggo ngurmati Firaun sing wis mati. Dataran dhuwur Giza, utawa “Giza Necropolis” ing Lembah Mati Mesir duwe sawetara piramida (ing ngendi piramida agung iku sing paling gedhe), sawetara makam cilik, sawetara candhi, lan Sphinx sing gedhe. Piramida gedhe digawe kanggo ngurmati Firaun Khufu, lan akeh piramida sing luwih cilik, makam, lan kuil dibangun kanggo ngurmati garwa lan kaluwargane Khufu.

ref: Piramida Agung ing Giza minangka salah sawijining pitu kaelokan sing isih ana nganti saiki. Dibangun dening wong Mesir ing abad kaping telu SM, Piramida Gedhe yaiku salah siji saka sakehing struktur piramida sing dibangun kanggo ngurmati Firaun sing wis mati. Dataran dhuwur Giza, utawa “Giza Necropolis” ing Lembah Mati Mesir duwe sawetara piramida (ing ngendi piramida agung iku sing paling gedhe), sawetara makam cilik, sawetara candhi, lan Sphinx sing gedhe. Piramida gedhe digawe kanggo ngurmati Firaun Khufu, lan akeh piramida sing luwih cilik, makam, lan kuil dibangun kanggo ngurmati garwa lan kaluwargane Khufu.

src: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
mt: Temple Artemis ing Ephesus diserang ing tanggal 21 Juli 356 SM ing ngendi Herostratus nggawa tindakan kebakaran. Miturut cerita, panggungane yaiku ketenangan. Penduduk Ephesus, marah, ngumumake Herostratus' nama ora diwaca. Historian Yunani Strabo nglaporke ngendi Herostratus' nama, sing kaya kita tahu. Temple diserang ing malam kanggo Alexander the Great lair. Alexander, minangka raja, tawar kanggo ngruwatake temple, nanging tawarane ora disetujui. Nalika Alexander mati, temple diwuwuhake ing 323 SM.
ref: Kuil Artemis ing Ephasus dirusak ing 21 Juli, 356 SM ing sajroning tumindak pembakaran sing ditindakake dening Herostratus. Miturut crita, dedelan kasebut pancen terkenal kanthi beya pira wae. Wong efesus, sing nesu, ngumumake yen jeneng Herostratus ora tau dicathet. Ahli sejarah Yunani Strabo banjur nyathet jenenge, sing kita kenal saiki. Candhi kuwi dirusak nalika Alexander Agung lair wengi kae. Alexander, minangka raja, nawarne kanggo mbayar mbangun kuil maneh, nanging tawarane ditolak. Banjur sakwise Alexander mati, kuile dibangun maneh ing 323 BCE.

src: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
mt: Transportasi kawruh kawruh yaiku kaki, manungsa mulai berjalan tegak dua juta taun kepungkur karo munculane Homo Erectus (artinya manungsa tegak). Pendahulu, Australopithecus ora berjalan tegak kaya kebiasaan. Bipedal spesialisasi ditemukake ing fosil Australopithecus saka 4.2-3.9 yuta taun kepungkur, walaupun Sahelanthropus bisa berjalan karo loro kaya awal kaya tujuh yuta taun kepungkur.
ref: Wiwitan kendharaan sing dikenal iku mlaku, manungsa wiwit mlaku jejeg rong yuta taun kapungkur kanthi njedhule Homo Erectus (ateges manungsa sing mlaku jejeg). Para leluhure, Australopithecus ora mlaku kanthi jejeg saben dinane. Pangkususan sikil loro ditemokake ing fosil Australopithecus saka 4,2-3,9 yuta taun kepungkur, sanajan Sahelanthropus bisa mlaku sikil loro kanthi cepet sajrone pitung yuta taun kepungkur.

src: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
mt: Nggunakake kapal kanggo ngangkut barang yaiku cara sing paling efisien kanggo ngangkut ronghinga wong lan barang ing sagara. Tugasing angkatan sagara tradisional yaiku supaya negara kalian bisa nggawa wong lan barang kalian, sarta ing wektu sing padha, nggawa wong lan barang musuh kalian. Sawijining conto sing paling kawentar ing wektu sing anyar yaiku kampanye Atlantik Lor ing Perang Donya II. Amérikah Lor nggawa wong lan barang kanggo nggawa wong lan barang ing Atlantik Lor supaya bisa nggawa Britania. Nalika wektu sing padha, angkatan sagara Jerman, nggunakake U-boat, nggawa wong lan barang supaya bisa nggawa wong lan barang. Nalika wong lan barang kalah, Jerman mungkin bisa nggawa Britania kaya ing sagara Eropa.
ref: MIgunakake kapal kanggo mindhahake barang iku cara paling efektif kanggo mindhahake jumlah wong lan barang sing akeh nyebrang segara. Pagaweyan angkatan laut kanthi tradisional yaiku kanggo mesthekake yen negara sampeyan njaga kemampuan kanggo mindhahake wong lan barang-barang, nanging ing wektu sing padha, ngganggu mungsuh sampeyan supaya bisa mindhah wong lan barang-barange. Salah siji tuladha keri kang paling patut dicathet saka iki yaiku operasi militer Atlantik Lor kanggo Perang Donya II. Wong-wong Amerika nyoba mindhahake wong-wong lan bahan-bahan nyebrangi Samudra Atlantik kanggo nulungi Inggris. Kanthi wanci sing padha, angkatan laut Jerman, nggunakake prau-U, nyoba ngendhegke lakune. Upama Sekutu gagal, Jerman bisa uga bakal bisa ngalahake Inggris kaya dene sisa Eropa.

src: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
mt: Inventasi roda sengkang nggawe gerbong Assyria luwih enteng, luwih cepet, lan luwih siap kanggo ngejar para tentara lan gerbong liyane. Biji saka panah saka panah kacilane bisa ngepangkakakake baju zirah para tentara rival. Nalika 1000 SM, Assyria nggawe tentara kawula kapisan. Tentara kawula iku tentara sing nglawan ing punggawa. Saddle isih ora wis diinventarake, mula tentara kawula Assyria nglawan ing punggawa sing ora ana.
ref: Panemon rodha sing nganggo ruji rodha bisa nggawe kreta bangsa Asiria luwih entheng, luwih cepet, lan luwih cawis kanggo mlayu luwih cepet tinimbang para prajurit lan kreta liyane. Panah saka busur silang bisa nembus klambi wesi saka prajurit saingan. Watara 1000 SM, wong-wong Assyria nepungake kavaleri sepisan. Kavaleri minangka bala sing tarung numpak jaran. Pelana isih durung ditemokake, saengga para kavaleri Asyur tarung ing jaran sing wuda.

src: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
mt: Para Babilonia nggawe tiap-tiap dewa siji kuil utama sing dianggep dadi omah saka dewa. Orang-orang bakal nggawa korban menawa dewa lan imam bakal ngupayake kanggo ngejar dhasar-dhasar saka dewa menawa nggawe upacara lan festival. Kuil duwékekuil terbuka lan kemudian suaka sing ora bisa ditekani saka imam. Kadang-kadang piramid sing bentuk khusus, sing diarani ziggurats, dianggep dadi siji saka kuil-kuil. Atas saka piramid iku dadi suaka khusus kanggo dewa.
ref: Suku Babilonia iki mbangun candhi utama kanggo dewa-dewane sing dianggep dadi omah dewa. Wong-wong bakal nggawa sesajen kanggo para dewa lan para pandhita bakal njajal kanggo ngurus marang kebutuhane para dewa iku liwat upacara-upacara utawa festival-festival. Saben candhi wis plataran candhi sing mbukak lan banjur panggon pangaoban batin mung bisa dileboni para imam. Kadhangkala menara kusus kang mbengkeluk piramida, sing diarani ziggurat, dibangun dadi bagean candhi. Perangan puncak menara iku papan perlindhungan khusus kanggo dewa.
